18199.text: ¶Suddenly, in an instant,/_your crowds of evildoers shall become as fine dust,/_your violent mobs like flying chaff.

18200.text: /She shall be chastened by Jehovah of Hosts/_with thunderous quakings,/resounding booms, tempestuous blasts/_and conflagrations of devouring flame.

18201.text: ¶And the nations amassed to fight against Ariel,/_all who congregate at her stronghold/to distress her,/_shall be as a dream seen in the night:

18202.text: /like a hungry man who dreams he eats/_but awakens famished,/or like a thirsty man who dreams he drinks/_but wakes up faint and craving./So shall be all the nations/_that amass to fight against Mount Zion.

18203.text: ¶Procrastinate, and become bewildered;/_preoccupy yourselves, until you cry for help./Be drunk, but not with wine;/_stagger, but not from strong drink.

18204.text: /Jehovah has poured out on you/_a spirit of deep sleep:/he has shut your eyes, the prophets;/_he has covered your heads, the seers.

18205.text: ¶For you the sum of vision has become as the words of a sealed book that they give to one who is learned, saying, Please read this, and he answers, I cannot; it is sealed.

18206.text: Or if they give it to one who is unlearned, saying, Please read this, he answers, I am unlearned.

18207.text: ¶But my Lord says, Because these people/_approach me with the mouth/and pay me homage with their lips,/_while their heart remains far from me—/their piety toward me consisting of/_commandments of men learned by rote—

18208.text: /therefore it is that I shall again astound these people/_with wonder upon wonder,/rendering void the knowledge of their sages/_and the intelligence of their wise men insignificant.

18209.text: ¶Woe to those who contrive/_to hide their schemes from Jehovah!/They work in the dark, thinking,/_Who will see us? Who will know?

18210.text: /What a contradiction you are!/_Shall the potter be regarded as the clay?/Shall what is made say of its maker,/_He did not make me,/or a work of its designer, He doesn’t understand?

18211.text: /In a very little while, shall not Lebanon/_again become a fruitful land,/and lands now fruitful be considered backwoods?

18212.text: ¶In that day shall the deaf hear/_the words of the book/and the eyes of the blind see/_out of gross darkness.

18213.text: /The lowly shall obtain an increase of joy in Jehovah,/_and the poorest of men rejoice/_in the Holy One of Israel.

18214.text: ¶For tyrants shall come to nought and scorners cease;/_all who watch for iniquity shall be cut off—

18215.text: /those who at a word adjudge a man to be guilty,/_who ensnare the defender at court,/who for nothing turn away him who is in the right.

18216.text: ¶Therefore thus says Jehovah,/_who redeemed Abraham, to the house of Jacob:/No longer shall Jacob be dismayed;/_his face shall pale no more.

18217.text: /For when he sees among him his children,/_the work of my hands, hallowing my name,/devoted to the Holy One of Jacob,/_reverencing the God of Israel,

18218.text: /then will the erring in spirit gain understanding/_and they who murmured accept instruction.

18219.text: ¶Woe to you, rebellious sons, says Jehovah,/_for drawing up plans, but not by me,/for making alliances without my approval,/_only adding sin to sin!

18220.text: /They are bent on going down to Egypt—/_but have not inquired at my mouth—/on seeking protection in Pharaoh’s forces,/_on taking shelter in Egypt’s shadow.

18221.text: ¶But Pharaoh’s protection shall turn to your shame,/_shelter in Egypt’s shadow to embarrassment.

18222.text: /For all their officials at Zoan,/_and their envoys’ travels to Hanes,

18223.text: /they shall be utterly disgusted/_with a people who will avail them nothing;/they shall be of no help or benefit,/_but a humiliation and disgrace.

18224.text: ¶An oracle concerning the Beasts of Negeb:¶Through a land of hardship and vicissitudes,/_of lions and the roaring king of beasts,/_of vipers and the fiery flying serpent,/they carry their wealth/_on the backs of young asses,/their riches on the humps of camels,/_to a people who cannot profit them.

18225.text: ¶Egypt’s help shall be futile and vain;/_therefore I refer to her as an idle boast.

18226.text: ¶Go now, write on tablets concerning them;/_record it in a book for the end‐time,/_as a testimony forever.

18227.text: /They are a rebellious people, sons who break faith,/_children unwilling to obey the law of Jehovah,

18228.text: /who say to the seers, See not!/_and to those with visions,/Predict not what is right for us:/_flatter us; foresee a farce!

18229.text: /Get out of the way; move aside, off the path!/_Cease confronting us with the Holy One of Israel!

18230.text: ¶Therefore, thus says the Holy One of Israel:/_Because you have rejected this word,/and rely on manipulation and double dealing,/_and on them are dependent,

18231.text: /this iniquity will be to you as a perilous breach/_exposed in a high wall/_which suddenly and unexpectedly collapses.

18232.text: /It shall shatter with a crash/_like an earthenware vessel ruthlessly smashed,/among whose fragments shall not be found a shard/_with which to scoop lit embers from a fireplace,/or dip water from a tank.

18233.text: ¶For thus says my Lord Jehovah,/_the Holy One of Israel:/By a calm response triumph;/_with quiet confidence gain the victory./_But you would have none of it.

18234.text: /For you thought, Not so; we will flee on horses!/_Therefore shall you flee indeed./We will ride on swift mounts!/_Therefore shall your pursuers be swifter.

18235.text: /You will flee by the thousand at the threat of one,/_by thousands at the threat of five,/till you are left as a flagstaff on a mountaintop,/_an ensign on a hill.

18236.text: ¶Then will Jehovah delay his coming,/_that he may favor you;/_out of mercy toward you he will remain aloof./For Jehovah is the God of justice;/_blessed are all who wait for him.

18237.text: ¶O people of Zion, O inhabitants of Jerusalem,/_you shall have no cause to weep./He will graciously respond at the cry of your voice;/_he will answer you as soon as he hears it.

18238.text: /Though my Lord give you the bread of adversity/_and the water of affliction,/yet shall your Teacher remain hidden no longer,/_but your eyes shall see the Master.

18239.text: /Your ears shall hear words from behind you/_saying, This is the way; walk in it!/_should you turn left or right.

18240.text: /You will discard as unclean/_your graven idols plated with silver,/_your cast idols gilded in gold;/you will eject them/_as a menstruous woman her impurity/and say, Away with you!

18241.text: ¶Then will he water with rain/_the seed you sow in the ground,/that the land’s increase of food/_may be rich and abundant./In that day your cattle shall graze/_in ample pasturelands,

18242.text: /and the oxen and asses that till the soil/_eat grain silage winnowed with shovel and fork.

18243.text: ¶On all mountain heights and prominent hills/_shall appear streams of running water,/on the day of the great slaughter,/_when the towers fall.

18244.text: /The light of the moon/_shall be as the light of the sun,/_and the light of the sun increase sevenfold;/as the light of seven days shall it be,/_in the day Jehovah binds up/the fracture of his people/_and heals their open wound.

18245.text: ¶Behold, Jehovah Omnipotent coming from afar!/_His wrath is kindled, heavy is his grievance;/his lips flow with indignation,/_his tongue is like a devouring fire.

18246.text: /His breath is like a raging torrent/_that severs at the neck./He comes to sift the nations/_in the sieve of falsehood;/with an erring bridle on their jaws/_he will try the peoples.

18247.text: ¶But for you there shall be singing,/_as on the night when a festival commences,/and rejoicing of heart, as when men march/_with flutes [and drums and lyres]/on their way to the mountain of Jehovah,/_to the Rock of Israel.

18248.text: ¶Jehovah will cause his voice to resound,/_and make visible his arm descending in furious rage,/with flashes of devouring fire,/_explosive discharges and pounding hail.

18249.text: /At the voice of Jehovah/_the Assyrians will be terror‐stricken,/_they who used to strike with the rod.

18250.text: /At every sweep of the staff of authority,/_when Jehovah lowers it upon them,/they will be fought in mortal combat.

18251.text: ¶For Tophet has been prepared of old,/_a hearth indeed, made ready for rulers;/broad and deep is its fire pit and ample its pyre;¶Jehovah’s breath burns within it/_like a river of lava.

18252.text: ¶Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help,/_relying on horses,/putting their trust in immense numbers/_of chariots and vast forces of horsemen,/but who do not look to the Holy One of Israel,/_nor inquire of Jehovah!

18253.text: ¶Yet he too is shrewd/_and will bring disaster upon them,/_and not retract his words./He will rise up against the brood of miscreants/_and allies of evildoers.

18254.text: /The Egyptians are human, not divine;/_their horses are flesh, not spirit:/when Jehovah stretches out his hand,/_those who help them will stumble/_and those helped will fall;/both shall come to an end together.

18255.text: ¶For thus said Jehovah to me:/_As a lion or a young lion growls over the prey/when the shepherds muster in full force against him,/_and is not dismayed at the sound of their voice/_nor daunted by their numbers,/so shall Jehovah of Hosts be when he descends/_to wage war upon Mount Zion and upon its heights.

18256.text: /As birds hover over [the nest],/_so will Jehovah of Hosts guard Jerusalem;/by protecting it he will deliver it,/_by passing over it, preserve it.

18257.text: ¶Return to him from whom you have contrived to go far astray, O children of Israel.

18258.text: For in that day every one of you will despise your idolatrous silver and gold by which your hands have incurred guilt.

18259.text: ¶And Assyria shall fall by a sword not of man;/_a sword not of mortals shall devour them:/before that sword they shall waste away/_and their young men melt;

18260.text: /their captain shall expire in terror/_and their officers shrink from the ensign,/says Jehovah, whose fire is in Zion,/_whose furnace is in Jerusalem.

18261.text: ¶A king shall reign in righteousness/_and rulers rule with justice.

18262.text: /And a man shall become as a shelter/_from the wind or refuge from the storm,/like brooks of water in a desert place,/_or the shade of a large rock in arid country.

18263.text: ¶The eyes of those who see shall not be shut,/_and the ears of those who hear shall listen.

18264.text: /The minds of the rash shall learn understanding,/_and the tongues of the stammerers master eloquence.

18265.text: /The godless shall no longer be regarded as noble/_nor rogues considered respectable.

18266.text: ¶For the godless utter blasphemy;/_their heart ponders impiety:/how to practice hypocrisy and preach/_perverse things concerning Jehovah,/leaving the hungry soul empty,/_depriving the thirsty soul of drink.

18267.text: /And rogues scheme by malevolent means/_and insidious devices to ruin the poor,/and with false slogans and accusations/_to denounce the needy.

18268.text: /But the noble are of noble intent,/_and stand up for what is virtuous.

18269.text: ¶Up, and listen to my voice, O complacent women;/_you careless daughters, hear my words!

18270.text: /In little more than a year/_you shall be in anguish, O carefree ones,/for when the harvest is over,/_the produce shall fail to arrive.

18271.text: ¶Be alarmed, you complacent women;/_be perturbed, O careless daughters!/Strip yourselves bare;/_put sackcloth around your waists.

18272.text: /Beat your breasts for the choice fields/_and flourishing vines,

18273.text: /for my people’s land/_shall be overgrown with briars and thorns./Mourn for all the amusement houses/_in the city of entertainment,

18274.text: /for the palaces shall lie abandoned,/_the clamorous towns deserted./High rises and panoramic resorts/_shall become haunts for ever after,/the playground of wild animals,/_a browsing place for flocks.

18275.text: /Then shall a Spirit from on high/_be poured out on us;/the desert shall become productive land/_and lands now productive/_be reckoned as brushwood.

18276.text: ¶So shall justice inhabit the desert,/_and righteousness abide in the farmland.

18277.text: /And the effect of justice shall be peace,/_and the result of righteousness/_an assured calm forever.

18278.text: /My people shall dwell in peaceful settlements,/_in safe neighborhoods, in comfortable dwellings.

18279.text: ¶For by a hail shall forests be felled,/_cities utterly leveled.

18280.text: /Blessed are you, who shall then sow by all waters,/_letting oxen and asses range free.

18281.text: ¶Woe to you, despoiler,/_who yourself was not despoiled;/O treacherous one,/_with whom none have been treacherous:/when you have done with devastating,/_you shall be devastated;/when you are through betraying,/_they shall betray you!

18282.text: ¶O Jehovah, be favorable toward us;/_we have waited for you./Be our strength of arm from morning to morning,/_our salvation in troubled times.

18283.text: ¶The peoples fled from your thunderous voice;/_at your uprising the nations scattered.

18284.text: /Their spoil was harvested/_in the manner of caterpillars;/_like insatiable locusts they rushed upon it.

18285.text: /But Jehovah is supreme, for he dwells on high;/_with justice and righteousness he will replenish Zion.

18286.text: /Your faithfulness in time of trial/_shall prove to be a strength,/your wisdom and knowledge your salvation;/_your fear of Jehovah shall be your riches.

18287.text: ¶See, their stalwarts sob in public;/_the champions of peace weep bitterly.

18288.text: /The highways are desolate, travel is at an end./_The treaties have been violated,/their signatories held in contempt;/_man is disregarded.

18289.text: /The Land lies withered and forlorn,/_Lebanon wilts shamefully;/Sharon has been turned into a dry waste,/_Bashan and Carmel are denuded.

18290.text: ¶Now will I arise, says Jehovah;/_I will now become prominent,/_now gain preeminence.

18291.text: /You who conceived chaff and brought forth stubble,/_the fire of your own breath devours you!

18292.text: /Whole nations have been burned like lime,/_mown down like thorns and set ablaze.

18293.text: ¶Take heed what I have done, you who are far off;/_you who are near, be apprised of my might!

18294.text: /The sinners in Zion are struck with fear;/_the godless are in the grip of trembling:/Who among us can live through the devouring fire?/_Who among us can abide eternal burning?

18295.text: /They who conduct themselves righteously/_and are honest in word,/who disdain extortion/_and stay their hand from taking bribes,/who stop their ears at the mention of murder,/_who shut their eyes at the sight of wickedness.

18296.text: /They shall dwell on high;/_the impregnable cliffs are their fortress./Bread is provided them, their water is sure.

18297.text: ¶Your eyes shall behold the King in his glory/_and view the expanse of the earth.

18298.text: /You shall recount in your mind the terror:/_Where are those who conducted the census?/Where are those who levied the tax?/_Where are the ones who appraised the towers?

18299.text: /The insolent people are not to be seen,/_a nation of incomprehensible speech,/whose babbling tongue was unintelligible.

18300.text: ¶Behold Zion, the city of our solemn assemblies;/_let your eyes rest upon Jerusalem,/the abode of peace—an immovable tent,/_whose stakes shall never be uprooted,/_nor any of its cords severed.

18301.text: ¶May Jehovah cause us to dwell there,/_a country of rivers and broad streams,/where no warships sail/_or majestic fleets pass by.

18302.text: /For Jehovah is our Judge,/_and Jehovah our Lawgiver./Jehovah is our King; he himself will save us.

18303.text: /Their riggings hang loose;/_they hold not the mast in place/_nor spread out the sail./Now shall spoil in abundance be divided,/_and even the lame take part in the plunder.

18304.text: /None who reside there shall say, I am ill;/_the people who inhabit it/_shall be forgiven their iniquity.

18305.text: ¶Come near, you nations, and hear!/_Pay attention, you peoples!/Let the earth give heed, and all who are upon it,/_the world, and all who spring from it.

18306.text: /Jehovah’s rage is upon all nations,/_his fury upon all their hosts;/he has doomed them,/_consigned them to the slaughter.

18307.text: ¶Their slain shall be flung out/_and their corpses emit a stench;/their blood shall dissolve on the mountains,

18308.text: /their fat decompose [on the hills]—/_when the heavens are rolled up as a scroll,/_and their starry hosts shed themselves with one accord,/like withered leaves from a vine,/_or shriveled fruit from a fig tree.

18309.text: /When my sword drinks its fill in the heavens,/_it shall come down on Edom in judgment,/_on the people I have sentenced to damnation.

18310.text: ¶Jehovah has a sword that shall engorge with blood/_and glut itself with fat—/the blood of lambs and he‐goats,/_the kidney fat of rams./For Jehovah will hold a slaughter in Bozrah,/_an immense massacre in the land of Edom;

18311.text: /among them shall fall buffalo, bulls, and steers.¶Their land shall be saturated with blood,/_their soil enriched with fat.

18312.text: ¶For it is Jehovah’s day of vengeance,/_the year of retribution on behalf of Zion.

18313.text: ¶Edom’s streams shall turn into lava/_and her earth into brimstone;/_her land shall become as burning pitch.

18314.text: /Night and day it shall not be quenched;/_its smoke shall ascend forever./It shall remain a wasteland/_from generation to generation;/_through endless ages none shall traverse it.

18315.text: /But hawks and falcons shall possess it,/_and owls and ravens inhabit it./It shall be surveyed with muddled measure/_and chaotic weight.

18316.text: ¶Shall they summon its nobles when it is no kingdom,/_when all its lords no longer exist?

18317.text: /For thorns shall overgrow its palaces,/_thistles and briars its strongholds;/it shall become the haunt of howling creatures,/_a reserve for birds of prey.

18318.text: /Prairie wolves shall greet jackals,/_and wild goats call to one another./There too shall the night owl find repose/_and discover for herself a resting place.

18319.text: /There shall the hawk owl nest and lay eggs,/_hatch them and brood over her young./There too shall kites come together,/_each one accompanying her mate.

18320.text: ¶Search, and read it in the book of Jehovah:/_None is unaccounted for, not one lacks her mate./By his mouth he decreed it,/_by his Spirit he brings them together.

18321.text: /It is he who allots them an inheritance,/_his hand that divides it by measure./They shall possess it forever,/_inhabit it from generation to generation.

18322.text: ¶Wilderness and arid land shall be jubilant;/_the desert shall rejoice/_when it blossoms like the crocus.

18323.text: /Joyously it shall break out in flower,/_singing with delight;/it shall be endowed with the glory of Lebanon,/_the splendor of Carmel and Sharon./The glory of Jehovah and the splendor of our God/_they shall see there.

18324.text: /Strengthen the hands grown feeble,/_steady the failing knees.

18325.text: /Say to those with fearful hearts,/_Take courage, be unafraid!/See, your God is coming to avenge and to reward;/_God himself will come and deliver you.

18326.text: ¶Then shall the eyes of the blind be opened/_and the ears of the deaf unstopped.

18327.text: /Then shall the lame leap like deer,/_and the tongue of the dumb shout for joy./Water shall break forth in the wilderness/_and streams flow in the desert.

18328.text: /The land of mirages shall become one of lakes,/_the thirsty place springs of water;/in the haunt of howling creatures/_[shall marshes break out],/in the reserves shall come rushes and reeds.

18329.text: ¶There shall be highways and roads/_which shall be called the Way of Holiness,/for they shall be for such as are holy.¶The unclean shall not traverse them;/_on them shall no reprobates wander.

18330.text: /No lions shall be encountered there,/_nor shall wild beasts intrude./But the redeemed shall walk them,

18331.text: /the ransomed of Jehovah shall return;¶they shall come singing to Zion,/_their heads crowned with everlasting joy./They shall have won joy and gladness/_when sorrow and sighing flee away.

18332.text: ¶In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah’s reign, Sennacherib king of Assyria marched against all the fortified cities of Judea and seized them.

18333.text: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. And he took up a position by the aqueduct of the Upper Reservoir, on the road to the Laundry Plaza.

18334.text: And Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, overseer of the palace, Shebna the secretary, and Joah the son of Asaph, the record keeper, went out to him.

18335.text: ¶And Rabshakeh said to them, Please tell Hezekiah, Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: On what grounds do you behave with such confidence?

18336.text: Do you suppose that in war mere words are sufficient tactics or show of strength? In whom have you put your trust, that you have rebelled against me?

18337.text: It is clear you depend on the support of Egypt, that splintered reed which enters and pierces the palm of any man who leans on it. Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who rely on him!

18338.text: But if you tell me, We rely on Jehovah our God, is he not the one whose shrines and altars Hezekiah abolished, telling Judea and Jerusalem to worship only at this altar?

18339.text: Come now, wager with my lord the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able to put riders on them.

18340.text: How then shall you repulse even one of the least of my lord’s servants, depending as you do on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?

18341.text: Moreover, could I have marched against this land and destroyed it without Jehovah? For Jehovah told me to come against this land and destroy it.

18342.text: ¶Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to Rabshakeh, please speak to your servants in Aramaic, which we understand. Do not speak to us in Judean in the ears of the people who are on the wall.

18343.text: ¶But Rabshakeh replied, Did my lord send me to say these things to you and to your lord and not to the men sitting on the wall, who with you are to eat their own dung and drink their own urine?

18344.text: ¶Then Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in Judean, Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!

18345.text: Thus says the king: Do not let Hezekiah delude you! He cannot deliver you.

18346.text: Do not let Hezekiah make you trust in Jehovah by saying, Jehovah will surely save us; this city shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

18347.text: ¶Do not listen to Hezekiah! Thus says the king of Assyria: Make peace with me by coming out to me. Then every one of you will eat from his own vine and his own fig tree and drink water from his own cistern,

18348.text: until I come back and take you to a land like your own, a land of grain and wine, a land of grain fields and vineyards.

18349.text: ¶Beware, lest Hezekiah mislead you by saying, Jehovah will save us. Were any gods of the nations able to save their lands out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

18350.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Did they deliver Samaria out of my hand?

18351.text: Who of all the gods of those countries saved his land from my hand, that Jehovah should save Jerusalem from my hand?

18352.text: ¶But they remained silent, replying nothing, for the king had commanded them not to answer him.

18353.text: ¶Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, overseer of the palace, Shebna the secretary, and Joah the son of Asaph, the record keeper, went to Hezekiah with their clothes rent and reported to him the things Rabshakeh had said.

18354.text: ¶When King Hezekiah heard it, he rent his clothes and put on sackcloth and entered the house of Jehovah.

18355.text: And he sent Eliakim the overseer of the palace, Shebna the secretary, and the elders of the priests in sackcloth to the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz.

18356.text: they said to him, Thus says Hezekiah: This is a woeful day, a day of reproof and disgrace. Children have reached the point of birth, but there is no strength to deliver them.

18357.text: It may be that Jehovah your God has heard the words of Rabshakeh, whom his lord the king of Assyria has sent to scorn the living God, and will rebuke him for the things Jehovah your God has heard, were you to offer up prayer on behalf of the remnant that is left.

18358.text: ¶And when King Hezekiah’s servants came to Isaiah,

18359.text: ¶And Isaiah said to them, Tell your lord, Thus says Jehovah: Be not afraid because of the words with which you have heard the king of Assyria’s subordinates ridicule me.

18360.text: See, I will give him a notion to return home upon hearing a rumor, and will cause him to fall by a sword in his own land.

18361.text: ¶And when Rabshakeh heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish, he withdrew and found him fighting against Libnah.

18362.text: ¶Now Sennacherib received a report that Tirhakah king of Cush had set out to fight against him. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, telling them,

18363.text: Speak thus to Hezekiah king of Judah: Let not your God in whom you trust delude you into thinking that Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

18364.text: You yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done, annexing all lands. Shall you then escape?

18365.text: Did the gods of the nations my fathers destroyed deliver them? Did they deliver Gozan and Haran, Rezeph and the Edenites in Tel Assar?

18366.text: Where are the kings of Hamath and Arpad and the kings of the cities of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?

18367.text: ¶And Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to the house of Jehovah and unrolled it before Jehovah.

18368.text: And Hezekiah prayed to Jehovah and said,

18369.text: ¶O Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, who sits enthroned between the cherubim, you alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. It is you who made the heavens and the earth ...

18370.text: ¶O Jehovah, give ear and hear; O Jehovah, open your eyes and see. Listen to all the words Sennacherib has sent to mock the living God.

18371.text: ¶O Jehovah, the kings of Assyria have indeed destroyed all peoples and their lands,

18372.text: committing their gods to the fire. For they were no gods, but mere works of men’s hands, of wood and of stone, and so they could destroy them.

18373.text: But now, O Jehovah our God, deliver us out of his hand, that all kingdoms on earth may know that you alone are Jehovah.

18374.text: ¶Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent word to Hezekiah, saying, Thus says Jehovah, the God of Israel: Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria,

18375.text: this is what Jehovah has spoken against him:¶▼The Virgin Daughter of Zion holds you in contempt;/_ she laughs you to scorn./The Daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head at you.

18376.text: ¶Whom have you mocked and ridiculed?¶Against whom have you raised your voice,/_lifting your eyes to high heaven?/Against the Holy One of Israel!

18377.text: /By your servants you have blasphemed my Lord./_You thought, On account of my vast chariotry/I have conquered the highest mountains,/_the farthest reaches of Lebanon./I have felled its tallest cedars, its choicest cypresses./_I have reached its loftiest summit, its finest forest.

18378.text: /I have dug wells and drunk of foreign waters./_With the soles of my feet/I have dried up all Egypt’s rivers!

18379.text: ¶Have you not heard/_how I ordained this thing long ago,/how in days of old I planned it?/_Now I have brought it to pass./You were destined to demolish fortified cities,/_turning them into heaps of rubble,

18380.text: /while their timorous inhabitants/_shrank away in confusion,/becoming as wild grass, transiently green,/_or like weeds on a roof/that scorch before they grow up.

18381.text: ¶But I know where you dwell,/_and your comings and goings,/and how stirred up you are against me.

18382.text: /And because of your snortings/_and bellowings against me,/_which have mounted up to my ears,/I will put my ring in your nose/_and my bit in your mouth/and turn you back by the way you came.

18383.text: ¶But to you this shall be a sign:/_This year eat what grows wild,/_and the following year what springs up of itself./But in the third year sow and harvest,/_plant vineyards and eat their fruit:

18384.text: /the remnant of the house of Judah that survives/_shall once more take root below and bear fruit above.

18385.text: /For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant,/_and from Mount Zion a band of survivors./The zeal of Jehovah of Hosts will accomplish it.

18386.text: ¶Therefore, thus says Jehovah/_concerning the king of Assyria:/He shall not enter this city or shoot an arrow here.¶He shall not advance against it with armor,/_nor erect siegeworks against it.

18387.text: /By the way he came he shall return;/_he shall not enter this city, says Jehovah.

18388.text: /I will protect this city and save it,/_for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David.

18389.text: ¶Then the angel of Jehovah went out and slew a hundred and eighty‐five thousand in the Assyrian camp. And when men arose in the morning, there lay all their dead bodies!

18390.text: ¶So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. And he returned to Nineveh, where he dwelt.

18391.text: ¶And as he was worshiping in the temple of Nisroch his god, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer slew him with a sword and fled to the land of Ararat. And his son Esarhaddon succeeded him as king.

18392.text: ¶In those days Hezekiah became gravely ill. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him and said, Thus says Jehovah: Put your house in order. You will die; you will not recover.

18393.text: ¶At this Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall and prayed to Jehovah:

18394.text: I beseech you to remember, O Jehovah, how I have walked before you faithfully and with full purpose of heart and have done what is good in your eyes ... And Hezekiah wept disconsolately.

18395.text: ¶Then the word of Jehovah came to Isaiah:

18396.text: Go and tell Hezekiah, Thus says Jehovah, the God of your father David: I have heard your prayer and seen your tears. I will add fifteen years to your life.

18397.text: And I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; I will protect this city.

18398.text: ¶And Isaiah replied, This shall be a sign to you from Jehovah, that Jehovah will do the thing he has promised:

18399.text: See, I make the shadow cast by the afternoon sun on the dial of Ahaz recede the ten degrees it has gone down.

18400.text: ¶Hezekiah king of Judah’s account of his illness, written upon his recovery:

18401.text: ¶I said, in the prime of life/_must I depart through Sheol’s gates,/_deprived of the balance of my years?

18402.text: /I thought, I shall not see Jehovah/_in the land of the living;/I shall not now behold Man/_among those dwelling in mortality.

18403.text: /My tabernacle is being uprooted,/_carried away from me like a shepherd’s tent./My life is cut off like woven fabric;/_he is severing me from the loom.

18404.text: ¶Can I contain myself until morning,/_while like a lion he racks my whole frame?/Surely, as night has followed day,/_you are bringing on my end!

18405.text: /Like a mounting lark I twitter,/_like a dove I murmur./My eyes are drawn looking heavenward;/_[I am utterly sleepless/_from bitterness of soul ... ]/O Jehovah, I am in straits; be my surety!

18406.text: ¶But what shall I say/_when he has already spoken for me,/_when he himself has brought it about?

18407.text: /O my Lord, by means of such trials/_comes a newness of life,/_and throughout them all the renewal of my spirit.

18408.text: /Surely, for my own good I am in such dire distress;/_by its means you draw my soul/_out of the Pit of Dissolution./For you have cast all my sins behind you,/_[restoring and reviving me].

18409.text: ¶For Sheol cannot praise you, nor Death glorify you;/_those who go down into the Pit/_have no further hope of your faithfulness.

18410.text: /But the living, only they bring you praise,/_as I do this day;/from father to sons they pass on/_the knowledge of your faithfulness.

18411.text: /O Jehovah, may it please you to save me,/_and we will perform music/all the days of our lives in the house of Jehovah.

18412.text: ¶And Isaiah gave instructions to take fig packs and apply them to the swelling so that he would recover.

18413.text: ¶But Hezekiah said, What of a sign that I shall again go up to the house of Jehovah?

18414.text: ¶At that time Merodach‐Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and gifts to Hezekiah, for he had heard of his illness and recovery.

18415.text: And Hezekiah was glad of them and showed the envoys his treasury—the silver and gold, the spices and fragrant oils, and his entire armory and all that was in his treasuries. There was nothing in his palace or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.

18416.text: ¶Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and said, What did those men say to you, and where did they come from? And Hezekiah replied, They came from a distant land; they came to me from Babylon.

18417.text: And Isaiah asked, What did they see in your palace? And Hezekiah said, They saw everything there is in my palace. There is nothing in my treasuries that I did not show them.

18418.text: ¶Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of Jehovah of Hosts:

18419.text: The time shall come when everything in your palace, and all that your forefathers have treasured up until now, shall be carried away to Babylon. Nothing shall be left, says Jehovah.

18420.text: And from among your own sons, your future offspring and descendants, they shall take some to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.

18421.text: ¶But Hezekiah said to Isaiah, The word of Jehovah you have spoken is good. For he thought, Then there shall be peace and loyalty during my reign.

18422.text: ¶Comfort and give solace to my people,/_ says your God;

18423.text: speak kindly to Jerusalem./Announce to her that she has served her term,/_ that her guilt has been expiated./She has received from Jehovah’s hand/_ double for all her sins.

18424.text: ¶A voice calls out,/_In the desert prepare the way for Jehovah;/in the wilderness/_pave a straight highway for our God:

18425.text: /every ravine must be raised up,/_every mountain and hill made low;/the uneven ground must become level/_and rough terrain a plain.

18426.text: ¶For the glory of Jehovah shall be revealed/_and all flesh see it at once./By his mouth Jehovah has spoken it.

18427.text: ¶A voice said, Announce it./_And I asked, How shall I announce it?/All flesh is grass,/_and at its best like a blossom of the field.

18428.text: /Though the Spirit of Jehovah breathe within it,/_the people themselves are but herbage—

18429.text: /grass that withers, flowers that fade—/_only the word of our God endures forever.

18430.text: ¶Scale the mountain heights,/_O Zion, herald of good tidings./Raise your voice mightily,/_O Jerusalem, messenger of good news./Make yourself heard, be not afraid;/_proclaim to the cities of Judah: Behold your God!

18431.text: ¶See, my Lord Jehovah comes with power;/_his arm presides for him./His reward is with him; his work precedes him.

18432.text: /Like a shepherd he pastures his flock:/_the lambs he gathers up with his arm/_and carries in his bosom;/the ewes that give milk he leads gently along.

18433.text: ¶Who measured out the waters/_with the hollow of his hand/and gauged the heavens/_by the span of his fingers?/Who compiled the earth’s dust by measure,/_weighing mountains in scales,/_hills in a balance?

18434.text: /Who has comprehended the Spirit of Jehovah,/_that a man should let him know his plan?

18435.text: /Of whom was he counselled/_that he might be enlightened,/by whom instructed in the path of discretion,/_imparting to him knowledge,/_acquainting him with the way of understanding?

18436.text: ¶The nations are but drops from a bucket,/_counting no more than dust on a balance;/_the isles he displaces as mere specks.

18437.text: /Lebanon would not suffice to kindle a fire,/_nor all its beasts be adequate for sacrifice.

18438.text: /Before him all nations are as nothing;/_as less than the ether they are reckoned by him.

18439.text: ¶To whom then will you liken God?/_What does he resemble in your estimation?

18440.text: /A figure cast by the artisan,/_overlaid by the smith with gold,/_fitted with a silver chain from the craftsman?

18441.text: /Those too poor for this type of sacrifice/_select a wood that resists decay./They seek an expert sculptor/_to carve them an image that will not deteriorate.

18442.text: ¶Are you so unaware, that you have not heard?/_Have you not been told before,/that you do not understand/_by whom the earth was founded?

18443.text: /—By him who sits enthroned above the earth’s sphere,/_to whom its inhabitants are as grasshoppers,/who suspends the heavens like a canopy,/_stretching them out as a tent to dwell in.

18444.text: /By him who brings potentates to nought/_and makes the authorities of the world null and void.

18445.text: /When scarcely they are planted,/_or scarcely they are sown,/when hardly their stock has taken root in the earth,/_he puffs at them and they wither,/and a storm sweeps them off as chaff.

18446.text: ¶To whom then will you liken me,/_to whom can I be compared? says the Holy One.

18447.text: /Lift your eyes heavenward and see:/_Who formed these?/He who brings forth their hosts by number,/_calling each one by name./Because he is almighty and all powerful,/_not one is unaccounted for.

18448.text: ¶Why then do you say, O Jacob,/_and speak thus, O Israel:/Our path has become obscured from Jehovah;/_our cause is overlooked by our God?

18449.text: ¶Is it not known to you; have you not heard?/_Jehovah is the God of eternity,/_Creator of the ends of the earth./He does not grow faint or weary;/_his intelligence cannot be fathomed.

18450.text: /He supplies the weary with energy/_and increases in vigor those who lack strength.

18451.text: /Youths grow faint and weary,/_and young men slump down of exhaustion.

18452.text: /But they who hope in Jehovah/_shall be renewed in strength:/they shall ascend as on eagles’ wings;/_they shall run without wearying,/_they shall walk and not faint.

18453.text: ¶Be silent before me, O isles;/_become still, you peoples!/Let them come forward and state their case;/_let us stand trial together.

18454.text: ¶Who has raised up Righteousness from the east,/_calling him to the place of his foot?/Who has delivered nations to him,¶toppled their rulers,/_rendering them as dust to his sword,/_as driven stubble to his bow?

18455.text: /He puts them to flight, passing on unhindered/_by paths his feet have never trod.

18456.text: ¶Who is at work accomplishing this,/_foreordaining dynasties?/I, Jehovah, first and last, am he.

18457.text: ¶The isles look on in fear;/_the ends of the earth are in trembling./They flock together/_and come

18458.text: to one another’s aid,/saying, each to his fellow, Courage!

18459.text: The artisan encourages the smith,/_and he who beats with a hammer/_urges him who pounds the anvil./They say of the welding, It is good,/_though they fasten it with riveting/_that it may not come loose.

18460.text: ¶But you, O Israel, my servant,/_Jacob, whom I have chosen,/_offspring of Abraham my beloved friend,

18461.text: /you whom I have taken from the ends of the earth,/_called from its farthest limits—/to you I say, You are my servant;/_I have accepted you and not rejected you.

18462.text: /Be not fearful, for I am with you;/_be not dismayed, for I am your God./I will strengthen you; I will also succor you/_and uphold you with my righteous right hand.

18463.text: ¶See, all who are enraged at you/_shall earn shame and disgrace;/_your adversaries shall come to nought, and perish.

18464.text: /Should you look for those who contend with you,/_you shall not find them;/whoever wars against you/_shall be reduced to nothing.

18465.text: /For I, Jehovah your God,/_hold you by the right hand and say to you,/Have no fear; I will help you.

18466.text: ¶Be not afraid, you worms of Jacob;/_O men of Israel, [be not dismayed]:/I am your help, says Jehovah;/_your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.

18467.text: /I will make of you a sharp‐toothed threshing sledge/_of new design, full of spikes:/you shall thresh mountains to dust/_and make chaff of hills.

18468.text: /As you winnow them, a wind shall take them away,/_a tempest dispel them./Then will you rejoice in Jehovah/_and glory in the Holy One of Israel.

18469.text: ¶When the poor and needy require water,/_and there is none,/and their tongue becomes parched with thirst,/_I Jehovah will answer their want;/_I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

18470.text: /I will open up streams in barren hill country,/_springs in the midst of the plains;/I will turn the desert into lakes,/_parched lands into fountains of water.

18471.text: /I will bring cedars and acacias,/_myrtles and oleasters in the wilderness;/I will place cypresses,/_elms and box trees in the steppes—

18472.text: /that all may see it and know, consider it,/_and perceive that Jehovah’s hand did this,/that the Holy One of Israel created it.

18473.text: ¶Present your case, says Jehovah;/_submit your evidence, says the King of Jacob.

18474.text: /Let them come forward and recount to us/_their prophecies of events heretofore./What were they? Tell us,/_that we may examine them/and know whether they were fulfilled./_Or predict the future for us:

18475.text: /Tell us of events to come hereafter,/_so that we may know you are gods./Perform something good or evil/_at which we will be dazzled and all stand in awe.

18476.text: /It is clear you are of no account,/_that your works amount to nothing;/whoever accepts you is himself an abomination.

18477.text: ¶I have raised up one from the north/_who calls on my name,/_who shall come from the direction of sunrise./He shall come upon dignitaries as on mud,/_tread them as clay like a potter.

18478.text: ¶Who announced this beforehand, so we would know,/_declared it ahead of time,/_that we might say, He was right?/Indeed, not one could foretell it,/_not one make it known;/no one has heard from you/_any [prophetic] utterance.

18479.text: /But to Zion, he shall be its harbinger;/_I will appoint him as/a herald of good tidings to Jerusalem.

18480.text: ¶For when I looked there was no one,/_not one who could offer counsel,/or when I questioned them,/_who could answer a word.

18481.text: /Surely they are all iniquitous,/_their works worthless;/their outpourings are but wind and emptiness.

18482.text: ¶My servant whom I sustain,/_my chosen one in whom I delight,/him I have endowed with my Spirit;/_he will dispense justice to the nations.

18483.text: /He will not shout or raise his voice/_to make himself heard in public.

18484.text: /Even a bruised reed he will not break;/_a dim wick he will not snuff out./He will perform the work of justice/_in the cause of truth.

18485.text: /Neither shall he himself grow dim or be bruised/_until he has brought about justice in the earth./The isles await his law.

18486.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah, God,/_who frames and suspends the heavens,/who gives form to the earth and its creatures,/_the breath of life to the people upon it,/_spirit to those who walk on it:

18487.text: /I Jehovah have rightfully called you/_and will grasp you by the hand;/I have created you and appointed you/_to be a covenant for the people,/_a light to the nations,

18488.text: /to open eyes that are blind,/_to free captives from confinement/and from prison those who sit in darkness.

18489.text: ¶I am Jehovah; that is my name./_I will not relinquish my glory to another,/_nor my praise to wrought idols.

18490.text: /The prophecies of the former events/_indeed came to pass,/but new things I yet foretell./_Before they spring up I declare them to you.

18491.text: ¶Sing to Jehovah a new song;/_sing his praise from the end of the earth./Let the sea roar, and all that lives in it,/_the isles and they who inhabit them.

18492.text: /Let the desert and its cities raise their voice,/_and the villages where Kedar dwells;/let the inhabitants of Sela sing for joy/_and cry out from the tops of the mountains.

18493.text: /O let them give glory to Jehovah,/_and in the isles speak out in praise of him.

18494.text: ¶Jehovah will come forth like a warrior,/_his passions aroused like a fighter;/he will give the war cry,/_raise the shout of victory over his enemies.

18495.text: /For a long time I have been silent,/_keeping still and restraining myself./But now I will scream like a woman in labor/_and breathe hard and fast all at once.

18496.text: /I will lay waste mountains and hills/_and make all their vegetation wither;/I will turn rivers into dry land and evaporate lakes.

18497.text: ¶Then will I lead the blind by a way they did not know,/_and guide them in paths unfamiliar;/the darkness confronting them I will turn into light,/_and the uneven ground make level./These things I will not fail to perform.

18498.text: ¶But those who trust in idols/_and esteem their images as gods/_shall retreat in utter confusion.

18499.text: /O you deaf, listen; O you blind, look and see!

18500.text: /Who is blind but my own servant,/_or so deaf as the messenger I have sent?/Who is blind like those I have commissioned,/_as uncomprehending as the servant of Jehovah—

18501.text: /seeing much but not giving heed,/_with open ears hearing nothing?

18502.text: ¶It is the will of Jehovah that,/_because of his righteousness,/_they magnify the law and become illustrious.

18503.text: /Instead, they are a people plundered and sacked,/_all of them trapped in holes,/_hidden away in dungeons./They have become a prey, yet no one rescues them,/_a spoil, yet none demands restitution.

18504.text: ¶Who among you hearing this/_will take heed of it hereafter,/_and be mindful and obey?

18505.text: /Who is it that hands Jacob over to plunder/_and Israel to despoilers, if not Jehovah,/_against whom we have sinned?/For they have no desire to walk in his ways/_or obey his law.

18506.text: /So in the heat of his anger/_he pours out on them the violence of war,/till it envelopes them in flames—/_yet they remain unaware—/till it sets them on fire;/_yet they take it not to heart.

18507.text: ¶But now, thus says Jehovah—/_he who formed you, O Jacob,/_he who created you, O Israel:/Do not fear, for I have redeemed you./_I have called you by name; you are mine.

18508.text: /When you cross the waters, I will be with you;/_when you traverse the rivers,/_you shall not be overwhelmed./Though you walk through the fire,/_you shall not be burned;/its flame shall not consume you.

18509.text: ¶For I Jehovah am your God,/_I, the Holy One of Israel, am your Savior;/Egypt I have appointed as ransom for you,/_Cush and Seba I give in place of you.

18510.text: /Because you are precious and revered in my eyes,/_and because I love you,/I give men in return for you,/_peoples in exchange for your life.

18511.text: ¶Do not fear, for I am with you./_I will bring your offspring from the east/_and gather you from the west;

18512.text: /I will say to the north, Give up!/_to the south, Withhold not!/Bring my sons from afar/_and my daughters from the end of the earth—

18513.text: /all who are called by my name,/_whom I have formed, molded and wrought/_for my own glory.

18514.text: /Let go the people who are blind, yet have eyes,/_who are deaf, yet have ears.

18515.text: ¶When all nations unitedly assembled,/_when the peoples were gathered together,/who among them foretold these things,/_or predicted events that have come to pass?/Let them bring their witnesses/_and justify themselves,/that those within hearing may say, It is true.

18516.text: /But you are my witnesses, says Jehovah,/_my servant whom I have chosen,/to the end that you may recognize it and believe me,/_and perceive that I was the one who foretold them—/before me no god was formed,/_nor shall one exist after me.

18517.text: ¶I myself am Jehovah;/_apart from me there is no savior.

18518.text: /It is I who foretold and wrought salvation,/_making it known/_when there was no strange god among you./You are my witnesses, says Jehovah,/_that I am divine,

18519.text: /that from the first I have been present—/_from my hand none can deliver;/when I work, who can thwart it?

18520.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah, the Holy One of Israel,/_your Redeemer:/For your sake I launch an attack on Babylon/_and bring down as fugitives all the Chaldeans,/_they who sing the praises of shipping.

18521.text: /I Jehovah, your Holy One,/_Creator of Israel, am your King.

18522.text: /Thus says Jehovah—/_who provides a way in the Sea,/_a path through the mighty waters,

18523.text: /who dispatches chariots and horses,/_armies of men in full strength;/they lie down as one, to rise no more,/_they flicker and die, snuffed out like a wick—

18524.text: /Never mind the prophecies of bygone events;/_do not dwell on things of the past.

18525.text: /See, I do a new thing; it is now springing up./_Surely, you are aware of it:/I am making roads through the desert,/_streams in the wasteland.

18526.text: /The wild beasts do me honor,/_the jackals and birds of prey,/for bringing water to the wilderness,/_streams to the dry land,/that I may give drink to my chosen people,

18527.text: /the people I formed for myself/_to speak out in praise of me.

18528.text: ¶But you do not call upon me, O Jacob;/_you have grown weary of me, O Israel.

18529.text: /Yet I required not that you bring me/_offerings from your flocks/_or pay me homage by sacrificial slaughter;/I have not burdened you with oblations/_or wearied you with burning incense.

18530.text: /Nor have I burdened you to buy me/_the fragrant calamus/_or sate me with the fat of immolations./Yet you have burdened me with your sins,/_wearied me with your iniquities.

18531.text: /But it is I myself, and for my own sake,/_who blot out your offenses,/_remembering your sins no more.

18532.text: ¶Recount for me the past;/_let us plead each our case./_Speak up and vindicate yourself.

18533.text: /Your first father transgressed;/_your spokesmen sinned against me.

18534.text: /Therefore I let the holy cities be profaned;/_I gave Jacob to be ostracized, Israel to execration.

18535.text: ¶Hear now, Jacob my servant,/_and Israel whom I have chosen.

18536.text: /Thus says Jehovah, your Maker,/_who formed you from the womb and succored you:/Be not afraid, O Jacob, my servant,/_and Jeshurun whom I have chosen.

18537.text: ¶I will pour water on the thirsty soil,/_showers upon the dry ground;/I will pour out my Spirit on your offspring,/_my blessing upon your posterity.

18538.text: /They shall shoot up like grass/_among streams of water,/_like willows by running brooks.

18539.text: /One will say, I am Jehovah’s,/_and another name himself Jacob./Yet others will inscribe on their arm, To Jehovah,/_and adopt the name Israel.

18540.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah, the King of Israel,/_Jehovah of Hosts, their Redeemer:/I was at the first and I am at the last;/_apart from me there is no God.

18541.text: /Who predicts what happens as do I,/_and is the equal of me/in appointing a people from of old as types,/_foretelling things to come?

18542.text: /Be not perturbed or shaken./_Have I not made it known to you from of old?/Did I not foretell it, you being my witnesses?/_Is there a God, then, apart from me?/There is no Rock unknown to me.

18543.text: ¶All who manufacture idols are deranged;/_the things they cherish profit nothing./Those who promote them are themselves/_sightless and mindless, to their own dismay.

18544.text: /Who would fashion a god or cast an idol/_that cannot benefit them?

18545.text: /Their whole society is confused;/_their fabricators are mere mortals./Were they all to assemble/_and take their stand before me,/they would at once cringe in fear.

18546.text: ¶The smith with his tools works the iron over the coals/_and gives it shape by hammering;/he forges his god by the strength of his arm:/_when he becomes hungry, he no longer has strength;/if he fails to drink water, he begins to grow faint.

18547.text: ¶The woodworker draws a diagram,/_sketching his idol with a marker./He creates it by chiseling to the outline of the dividers;/_he gives it a human likeness, resembling man’s beauty,/_fit to lodge in a house.

18548.text: ¶He is required to cut down cedars;/_he must select holms and oaks/and care for them among the trees of the forest./_He plants firs, which the rain makes grow:

18549.text: /that which serves men as fuel,/_which they use to warm themselves/_or light fire with to bake bread,/of that they create gods which they adore,/_from it they make idols to which they stoop.

18550.text: ¶Half of it they burn in the fire./_Over it they broil a roast;/they eat the meat and are satisfied./_They also warm themselves and say,/_Ah, it is warm in front of the fire!

18551.text: /From the rest they make a god, their idol,/_to which they bow in adoration and pray,/Save us; you are our god!

18552.text: ¶They have become unaware and insensible;/_their eyes are glazed so they cannot see,/_their minds are incapable of discernment.

18553.text: /They reflect not,/_nor have the sense or comprehension to say,/A part of this I burned in the fire;/_I also baked bread in its embers,/_roasted meat and ate it./Am I not making an abomination of what is left?/_Do I not stoop to a mere lump of wood?

18554.text: /They are followers of ashes;/_their deluded minds have distracted them./They cannot liberate themselves from them or say,/_Surely this thing in my hand is a fraud.

18555.text: ¶Ponder these things, O Jacob, and you, O Israel,/_for you are my servant./I have created you to be my servant, O Israel;/_Do not disregard me.

18556.text: /I have removed your offenses like a thick fog,/_your sins like a cloud of mist./Return to me; I have redeemed you.

18557.text: /Sing, O heavens, for what Jehovah has done;/_cause it to resound, O earth beneath!/Burst into song, O mountains,/_forests, and all trees therein:/Jehovah has redeemed Jacob;/_he shall be glorified in Israel.

18558.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah, your Redeemer,/_who formed you from the womb:/I am Jehovah, the Maker of all things,/_who alone suspends the heavens,/_who himself gives form to the earth,

18559.text: /who annuls the predictions of impostors/_and makes fools of diviners,/who turns wise men about/_and makes nonsense of their knowledge,

18560.text: /who fulfills the word of his servant,/_accomplishes the aims of his messengers,/who says of Jerusalem, It shall be reinhabited,/_and of the cities of Judah, They shall be rebuilt,/_their ruins I will restore,

18561.text: /who says to the deep, Become dry;/_I am drying up your currents,

18562.text: /who says of Cyrus, He is my shepherd;/_he will do whatever I will./He will say of Jerusalem that it must be rebuilt,/_its temple foundations relaid.

18563.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah to his anointed,/_to Cyrus, whom I grasp by the right hand,/to subdue nations before him,/_to ungird the loins of rulers,/opening doors ahead of him,/_letting no gates remain shut:

18564.text: /I will go before you and level all obstacles;/_I will break in pieces brazen doors/_and cut through iron bars.

18565.text: /I will give you hidden treasures/_and secret hoards of wealth—/that you may know that it is I Jehovah,/_the God of Israel, who calls you by name.

18566.text: ¶For the sake of my servant Jacob,/_and Israel my chosen, I call you by name—/_I named you when yet you knew me not.

18567.text: /I am Jehovah, there is none other;/_apart from me there is no God./_I girded you up when yet you knew me not—

18568.text: /that men from where the sun rises to where it sets/_may know that without me there is nothing,/that I am Jehovah, and that there is none other.

18569.text: ¶I fashion light and form darkness;/_I occasion peace and cause calamity./_I, Jehovah, do all these things.

18570.text: /Rain down from above, O heavens;/_let the skies overflow with righteousness./Let the earth receive it and salvation blossom;/_let righteousness spring up forthwith./I, Jehovah, create it.

18571.text: ¶Woe to those in conflict with their Maker,/_mere shards of earthenware pottery!/As though the clay were to say to him who molds it,/_What are you doing?/_Your hands have no skill for the work!

18572.text: /Woe to those who say to their Father,/_What have you begotten?/or to the Woman, What have you borne?

18573.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah,/_the Holy One of Israel, their Maker:/Will you ask me for signs concerning my children,/_or dictate to me about the deeds of my hands?

18574.text: /It is I who made the earth/_and created man upon it;/I with my hand suspended the heavens,/_appointing all their host.

18575.text: /It is I who rightfully raise him up,/_who facilitate his every step;/he will rebuild my city and set free my exiles/_without price or bribe, says Jehovah of Hosts.

18576.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_The wealth of Egypt and merchandise of Cush/shall pass on to you and become yours,/_as shall the Sabeans, a people tall in stature./They shall walk behind you in chains/_and bow down to you, entreating you,/Surely God is in you; no other gods exist!

18577.text: ¶Truly you are a God who dissembles himself,/_O Savior, God of Israel.

18578.text: ¶As one, the makers of inventions retired in disgrace,/_utterly dismayed and embarrassed.

18579.text: /But Israel is saved by Jehovah/_with an everlasting salvation;/you shall not be dismayed or put to shame/_worlds without end.

18580.text: ¶For thus says Jehovah who created the heavens,/_the God who formed the earth—/who made it secure and organized it,/_not to remain a chaotic waste,/but designed it to be inhabited:/_I am Jehovah, there is none other.

18581.text: /I speak not in secret/_from somewhere in a land of darkness;/I do not ask Jacob’s offspring/_to seek me amid chaos./I Jehovah tell righteousness/_and am forthright of speech.

18582.text: ¶Gather yourselves and come;/_draw near, all you fugitives of the nations./They who carried about their wooden idols/_and prayed to gods that could not save them/_were caught unawares.

18583.text: /Speak up and present your case;/_go ahead and consult one another./Who foretold these things of old,/_predicted them long ago?/Did not I, Jehovah,/_apart from whom there is no God?/Did not I, the God of righteousness,/_except for whom there is no Savior?

18584.text: ¶Turn to me and save yourselves,/_all you ends of the earth;/I am God, there is none other.

18585.text: /By myself I swear it—/_righteousness has issued from my mouth,/_by a decree that cannot be revoked:/To me every knee shall bow/_and every tongue swear allegiance.

18586.text: /It shall be said of me,/_By Jehovah alone come vindication and might./Before him must come in shame/_all who were incensed against him.

18587.text: /In Jehovah shall all Israel’s offspring/_justify themselves and have cause to boast.

18588.text: ¶Bel slumps down, Nebo is stooped over:/_their idols are loaded upon beasts and cattle;/the images you bore aloft/_are piled as burdens on weary animals.

18589.text: /Such gods altogether sag and bow down,/_unable to rescue their burden;/they themselves go into captivity.

18590.text: ¶Hear me, O house of Jacob,/_and all you remnant of the house of Israel,/who have been a load on me since birth,/_borne up by me from the womb:

18591.text: /Even to your old age, I am present;/_till you turn grey, it is I who sustain you./It is I who made you, and I who bear you up;/_it is I who carry and rescue you.

18592.text: ¶To whom will you compare me or count me equal?/_To whom will you liken me,/_that we should appear similar?

18593.text: /They who squander gold from the purse/_and weigh out silver on the scales/hire a smith to make them a god/_they bow down to and worship.

18594.text: /They bear it aloft, carrying it on their shoulders;/_when they set it in place, there it stands,/_unable to budge from its spot./Though they cry to it for help, it does not answer;/_it cannot save them from trouble.

18595.text: ¶Put yourselves in mind of this/_and come to your senses;/_take it to heart, you offenders.

18596.text: /Review the prophecies of the events of old!/_I am God, there is none other./_I am divine; nothing resembles me.

18597.text: /I foretell the end from the beginning,/_from ancient times things not yet done./I speak, and my purposes take effect;/_I accomplish all my will.

18598.text: ¶I summon a bird of prey from the east,/_from a distant land/_the man who performs my counsel./What I have spoken, I bring to pass;/_what I have planned, I do.

18599.text: /Hear me, you stubborn‐hearted,/_who are far from righteousness:

18600.text: /I have brought near my righteousness;/_it is not now far off—/_my salvation shall no longer be delayed./I will grant deliverance in Zion,/_and to Israel my glory.

18601.text: ¶Get down and sit in the dust,/_O Virgin Daughter of Babylon;/squat on the ground, dethroned,/_O Daughter of the Chaldeans./You shall no more be spoken of/_as delicate and refined.

18602.text: /Take two grindstones and grind flour;/_unveil, disrobe, bare your legs,/_wade through streams:

18603.text: /your nakedness shall be exposed/_and your shame uncovered./I will take vengeance/_and not be entreated of men,

18604.text: /says our Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel,/_whose name is Jehovah of Hosts.

18605.text: ¶Sit speechless; retire into obscurity,/_O Daughter of the Chaldeans./No longer shall you be called,/_Mistress of Kingdoms.

18606.text: /I was provoked by my people,/_so I let my inheritance be defiled./I gave them into your hand,/_and you showed them no mercy;/even the aged you weighed down heavily with your yoke.

18607.text: /You thought, I, the Eternal Mistress, exist forever!/_and did not consider these,/_or remember her final destiny.

18608.text: ¶Now therefore hear this, O pampered lady,/_securely enthroned, thinking to herself,/I exist, and other than me there is nothing;/_I shall not be widowed or bereaved of children:

18609.text: /Bereavement and widowhood/_shall suddenly overtake you, both in one day./They shall come upon you in full,/_notwithstanding your many magical feats/_and exceedingly strong combinations.

18610.text: ¶Secure in your wickedness,/_you thought, No one discerns me./By your skill and science you were led astray,/_thinking to yourself, I exist,/_and there is none besides me!

18611.text: /Catastrophe shall overtake you,/_which you shall not know how to avert by bribes;/disaster shall befall you/_from which you cannot ransom yourself:/there shall come upon you sudden ruin/_such as you have not imagined.

18612.text: ¶Persist, then, with your combinations/_and with your many magical feats,/_at which you have exerted yourself since your youth./It may still be of use to you;/_perhaps you can hinder it.

18613.text: /But you are powerless, despite all your tactics./_Now let those who unravel the heavens,/who observe the stars/_and make predictions month by month,/stand by you and save you!

18614.text: ¶See, as stubble they are burnt up in the fire,/_unable themselves to escape the hand of the flame./These are no embers to warm anyone;/_such is no fire to sit by!

18615.text: /This is what your procurers have profited you—/_those for whom you have exerted yourself/_since your youth—/each deviates his own way;/_none is there to save you.

18616.text: ¶Hear this, O house of Jacob,/_you who are named Israel—/though you stem from the lineage of Judah—/_who take oaths in the name of Jehovah/and invoke the God of Israel,/_though not in truth or in righteousness,

18617.text: /who call yourselves of the holy city,/_upheld by the God of Israel,/_whose name is Jehovah of Hosts:

18618.text: /The prophecies of the events of the past/_I made known long beforehand;/no sooner did they issue from my mouth,/_than I caused them to be announced./Then, suddenly, I acted and they came about.

18619.text: ¶For I knew how stubborn you were—/_your neck was an iron sinew, your brow brazen—

18620.text: /therefore I told you them beforehand;/_I announced them to you before they transpired,/lest you should say, My idols did it;/_my graven and wrought images caused it!

18621.text: ¶But you have heard the whole vision;/_how is it you do not proclaim it?/Yet as of now, I announce to you new things,/_things withheld and unknown to you,

18622.text: /things now coming into being, not hitherto,/_things you have not heard of before,/_lest you should say, Indeed I knew them!

18623.text: /You have not heard them,/_nor have you known them;/before this your ears have not been open to them.For I knew you would turn treacherous;/_you were called a transgressor from the womb.

18624.text: ¶For my own name’s sake I have bridled my wrath;/_on account of my renown/I have shown restraint toward you/_by not entirely destroying you.

18625.text: /See, I am refining you, though not as silver;/_I am testing you in the crucible of affliction.

18626.text: /For my own sake, on my own account, I do it,/_that my name be not dishonored,/nor my glory, which I give to no other.

18627.text: ¶Hear me, O Jacob, and Israel, whom I have called:/_I am he who was at the first,/_and I am he who is at the last.

18628.text: /It was my hand that founded the earth,/_my right hand that stretched out the heavens;/when I call them, they arise at once.

18629.text: /All of you, assemble and hear:/_Who among you foretold these things?/It is him Jehovah loves,/_who shall perform his will in Babylon;/_his arm shall be against the Chaldeans.

18630.text: /I myself have spoken it, and also called him;/_I have brought him, and I will prosper his way.

18631.text: ¶Come near me and hear this:/_I have not made predictions in secret;/at their coming to pass, I have been present./_Now my Lord Jehovah has sent me;/his Spirit is in me.

18632.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah, the Holy One of Israel,/_your Redeemer:/I Jehovah your God instruct you to your good,/_guiding you in the way you should go.

18633.text: /Had you but obeyed my commandments,/_your peace would have been as a river,/_your righteousness like the waves of the sea;

18634.text: /your offspring would have been/_as the sands in number,/_your descendants as many as their grains./Their names would not have been cut off/_and obliterated from my presence.

18635.text: ¶Go forth out of Babylon, flee from Chaldea!/_Make this announcement with resounding voice;/broadcast it to the end of the earth./_Say, Jehovah has redeemed his servant Jacob.

18636.text: /They thirsted not when he led them through arid places:/_he caused water to flow for them from the rock;/he cleaved the rock and water gushed out.

18637.text: ¶But there is no peace, says Jehovah,/_for the wicked.

18638.text: ¶Hear me, O isles; listen, you distant peoples:/_Jehovah called me before I was in the belly;/before I was in my mother’s womb,/_he mentioned me by name.

18639.text: /He has made my mouth like a sharp sword—/_in the shadow of his hand he hid me./He has made me into a polished arrow—/_in his quiver he kept me secret.

18640.text: /He said to me, You are my servant,/_Israel, in whom I will be glorified.

18641.text: /I had thought, I have labored in vain,/_I have spent my strength for nothing/_and to no purpose!/Yet my cause rested with Jehovah,/_my recompense with my God.

18642.text: ¶For now Jehovah has said—/_he who formed me from the womb/to be his servant, to restore Jacob to him,/_Israel having been gathered to him;/for I won honor in the eyes of Jehovah/_when my God became my strength—

18643.text: /he said: It is too small a thing/_for you to be my servant/to raise up the tribes of Jacob/_and to restore those preserved of Israel./I will also appoint you to be a light to the nations,/_that my salvation may be to the end of the earth.

18644.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah,/_the Redeemer and Holy One of Israel,/to him who is despised as a person,/_who is abhorred by his nation,/_a servant to those in authority:/Kings shall rise up when they see you,/_princes shall prostrate themselves,/because Jehovah keeps faith with you,/_because the Holy One of Israel has chosen you.

18645.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_At a favorable time I have answered you;/_in the day of salvation I have come to your aid:/I have created you and appointed you/_to be a covenant of the people,/to restore the Land and reapportion the desolate estates,

18646.text: /to say to the captives, Come forth!/_and to those in darkness, Show yourselves!/They shall feed along the way/_and find pasture on all barren heights;

18647.text: /they shall not hunger or thirst,/_nor be smitten by the heatwave or the sun:/he who has mercy on them will guide them;/_he will lead them by springs of water.

18648.text: ¶All my mountain ranges I will appoint as roads;/_my highways shall be on high.

18649.text: /See these, coming from afar, these, from the northwest,/_and these, from the land of Sinim.

18650.text: /Shout for joy, O heavens; celebrate, O earth!/_Burst into song, O mountains!/Jehovah is comforting his people,/_showing compassion for his afflicted.

18651.text: ¶But Zion said, Jehovah has forsaken me,/_my Lord has forgotten me.

18652.text: /Can a woman forget her suckling infant,/_or feel no compassion for the child of her womb?/Although these shall forget, I will not forget you.

18653.text: /See, I have engraved you on my palms;/_I have sealed you to be continually before me.

18654.text: ¶Your sons shall hasten your ravagers away—/_those who ruined you shall depart from you.

18655.text: /Lift up your eyes and look around you;/_with one accord they gather and come to you./As surely as I live, says Jehovah,/_you shall adorn yourself with them all as with jewels,/bind them on you as does a bride.

18656.text: ¶For your ruins and ravaged places,/_and your land laid waste,/shall now be too small for your inhabitants,/_despite the departure of your devourers.

18657.text: /The children born during the time of your bereavement/_shall yet say in your ears,/This place is too cramped for us;/_give us space in which to settle!

18658.text: /And you will say to yourself,/_Who bore me these while I was bereaved and barren?/I was exiled, banished;/_by whom were these reared?/When I was left to myself, where were they?

18659.text: ¶Thus says my Lord Jehovah:/_I will lift up my hand to the nations,/_raise my ensign to the peoples;/and they will bring your sons in their bosoms/_and carry your daughters on their shoulders.

18660.text: /Kings shall be your foster fathers,/_queens your nursing mothers./They will bow down before you,/_their faces to the ground;/_they will lick the dust of your feet./Then shall you know that I am Jehovah,/_and that they who hope in me are not disappointed.

18661.text: ¶Can the warrior’s spoil be taken from him,/_or the tyrant’s captives escape free?

18662.text: /Yet thus says Jehovah: The warrior’s spoil/_shall indeed be taken from him,/and the tyrant’s captives escape free:I myself will contend with your contenders,/_and I will deliver your children.

18663.text: /I will feed your oppressors with their own flesh;/_they shall be drunk with their own blood as with wine./And all flesh shall know that I Jehovah am your Savior,/_that your Redeemer is the Valiant One of Jacob.

18664.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_Where is your mother’s bill of divorce/_with which I cast her out?/Or to which of my creditors did I sell you?/_Surely, by sinning you have sold yourselves;/because of your crimes is your mother cast off.

18665.text: ¶Why was no one there when I came;/_why did no one answer when I called?/Was my hand too short to redeem you;/_have I no power to deliver?/By a mere rebuke I dry up the Sea;/_rivers I turn into desert—/their fish become parched for lack of water/_and perish because of thirst.

18666.text: /I clothe the heavens with the blackness of mourning;/_I put up sackcloth to cover them.

18667.text: ¶My Lord Jehovah has endowed me with a learned tongue,/_that I may know how to preach/_to those grown weary a word to wake them up./Morning by morning he wakens my ear to hear,/_as at study;

18668.text: /my Lord Jehovah has opened my ear,/_and I rebel not, nor back away:

18669.text: /I offered my back to smiters,/_my cheeks to those who plucked out the beard;/I hid not my face from insult and spitting.

18670.text: ¶Because my Lord Jehovah helps me,/_I shall not be disgraced;/I have set my face like flint,/_knowing I shall not be confounded.

18671.text: /He who vindicates me is near me./_Who has a dispute with me? Let us face one another!/Who will bring charges against me?/_Let him confront me with them!

18672.text: /See, my Lord Jehovah sustains me./_Who then will incriminate me?/Surely all such shall wear out like a garment;/_the moth shall consume them.

18673.text: ¶Who among you fears Jehovah/_and heeds the voice of his servant,/who, though he walk in the dark and have no light,/_trusts in the name of Jehovah and relies on his God?

18674.text: /But you are lighters of fires, all of you,/_who illuminate with mere sparks./Walk then by the light of your fires/_and by the sparks you have kindled./This shall you have from my hand:/_you shall lie down in agony.

18675.text: ¶Hear me, you followers of righteousness,/_seekers of Jehovah:/Look to the rock from which you were cut,/_to the quarry out of which you were hewn;

18676.text: /look to Abraham your father,/_to Sarah who bore you./He was but one when I called him,/_but I blessed him by making him many.

18677.text: /For Jehovah is comforting Zion,/_bringing solace to all her ruins;/he is making her wilderness like Eden,/_her desert as the garden of Jehovah./Joyful rejoicing takes place there,/_thanksgiving with the voice of song.

18678.text: ¶Listen to me, my people;/_give heed to me, O my nation:/The law shall go forth from me;/_my precepts shall be a light to the peoples./Then, suddenly, I will act:

18679.text: /My righteousness shall be at hand/_and my salvation proceed;/my arms shall judge the peoples—/_the isles anticipate me, awaiting my arm.

18680.text: ¶Lift up your eyes to the heavens;/_look on the earth beneath:/the heavens shall vanish as by smoke,/_the earth wear out like a garment—/its inhabitants shall die in the manner of vermin.But my salvation shall be everlasting;/_my righteousness shall never fail.

18681.text: ¶Hear me, you who know righteousness,/_O people in whose heart is my law:/Do not fear the reproach of men;/_be undaunted by their ridicule.

18682.text: /For the moth shall consume them like a garment;/_moths shall devour them like wool./But my righteousness shall endure forever,/_my salvation through endless generations.

18683.text: ¶Awake, arise; clothe yourself with power,/_O arm of Jehovah!/Bestir yourself, as in ancient times,/_as in generations of old./Was it not you who carved up Rahab,/_you who slew the dragon?

18684.text: /Was it not you who dried up the Sea,/_the waters of the mighty deep,/and made of ocean depths a way/_by which the redeemed might pass?

18685.text: /Let the ransomed of Jehovah return!/_Let them come singing to Zion,/their heads crowned with everlasting joy;/_let them obtain joy and gladness,/and sorrow and sighing flee away.

18686.text: ¶I myself am your Comforter./_Who are you that you fear mortal man,/_the children of men who shall be turned to grass?

18687.text: /Have you forgotten Jehovah, your Maker—/_who suspends the heavens,/_who sets the earth in place—/that you go all day in constant dread/_of the oppressor’s rage/as he readies himself to wreak destruction?/_What is there to the wrath of the oppressor?

18688.text: /Soon now shall he who is bowed down be set free;/_he shall not die as those destined for the Pit,/_neither shall he want for food.

18689.text: /It is I Jehovah your God,/_whose name is Jehovah of Hosts,/_who stir up the Sea so that its waves roar.

18690.text: /I will put my words in your mouth/_and shelter you in the shadow of my hand,/while I replant the heavens and set the earth in place,/_that I may say to Zion, You are my people.

18691.text: ¶Rouse yourself; awaken and rise up, O Jerusalem,/_you who have drunk from Jehovah’s hand/the cup of his wrath,/_drinking to the dregs the bowl of stupor.

18692.text: /There was none to guide her/_among all the children she bore,/none to take her by the hand of all the sons she reared.

18693.text: ¶Twofold calamity has befallen you:/_desolation, ruin—and who laments you?/_famine, the sword—and who consoles you?

18694.text: /Your children lie in a faint at the corner of every street,/_taken in a net like buffalo./They have their fill of the wrath of Jehovah,/_of your God’s angry rebuke.

18695.text: ¶Now therefore hear this, O wretched one,/_drunk, though not with wine.

18696.text: /Thus says Jehovah, your Lord and God,/_who defends the cause of his people:/I am taking the cup of stupor from your hand;/_you shall drink no more from the bowl of my wrath.

18697.text: /And I give it into the hand of your tormentors,/_those who said of your life,/Lie prostrate that we may go over you—/_so that you made your back as the ground,/a mere thoroughfare to passers‐by.

18698.text: ¶Awake, arise; clothe yourself with power, O Zion!/_Put on your robes of glory, O Jerusalem, holy city./_No more shall the uncircumcised and defiled enter you.

18699.text: /Shake yourself free, rise from the dust;/_sit enthroned, O Jerusalem./Loose yourself from the bands around your neck,/_O captive Daughter of Zion.

18700.text: /Thus says Jehovah: You were sold without price,/_and you shall be redeemed without money.

18701.text: ¶For thus says my Lord Jehovah:/_At first my people went down to Egypt to sojourn there./_Then the Assyrians subjected them for nothing.

18702.text: /And now, what have I here? says Jehovah./_My people are taken over without price;/those who govern them/_act presumptuously, says Jehovah,/and my name is constantly abused all the day.

18703.text: ¶Therefore shall my people come to know my name;/_in that day they shall know/_that I, who speak, am at hand.

18704.text: /Then shall they say,/_How comely upon the mountains/are the feet of the messenger announcing peace,/_who brings tidings of good,/_who heralds salvation,/saying to Zion, Your God reigns!

18705.text: ¶Hark! Your watchmen lift up their voice;/_as one they cry out for joy:/for they shall see eye to eye/_when Jehovah returns to Zion.

18706.text: /Break out all together into song,/_you ruined places of Jerusalem:/Jehovah has comforted his people;/_he has redeemed Jerusalem.

18707.text: /Jehovah has bared his holy arm/_in the eyes of all nations,/that all ends of the earth may see/_our God’s salvation.

18708.text: ¶Turn away, depart;/_touch nothing defiled as you leave Babylon./Come out of her and be pure,/_you who bear Jehovah’s vessels.

18709.text: /But you shall not leave in haste or go in flight:/_Jehovah will go before you,/_the God of Israel behind you.

18710.text: ¶My servant, being astute, shall be highly exalted;/_he shall become exceedingly eminent:
