18711.text: /just as he appalled many—/_his appearance was marred beyond human likeness,/_his semblance unlike that of men—

18712.text: /So shall he yet astound many nations,/_kings shutting their mouths at him—/what was not told them, they shall see;/_what they had not heard, they shall consider.

18713.text: ¶Who has believed our revelation?/_On whose account has the arm of Jehovah/_been revealed?

18714.text: ¶Like a sapling he grew up in his presence,/_a stalk out of arid ground./He had no distinguished appearance,/_that we should notice him;/he had no pleasing aspect,/_that we should find him attractive.

18715.text: /He was despised and disdained by men,/_a man of grief, accustomed to suffering./As one from whom men hide their faces/_he was shunned, deemed by us of no merit.

18716.text: ¶Yet he bore our sufferings, endured our griefs,/_though we thought him stricken,/_smitten of God, and humbled.

18717.text: /But he was pierced for our transgressions,/_crushed because of our iniquities;/the price of our peace he incurred,/_and with his wounds we are healed.

18718.text: /We all like sheep had gone astray,/_each of us headed his own way;/Jehovah brought together upon him the iniquity of us all.

18719.text: ¶He was harassed, yet submissive,/_and opened not his mouth—/like a lamb led to slaughter,/_like a sheep, dumb before its shearers,/_he opened not his mouth.

18720.text: /By arrest and trial he was taken away./_Who can apprise his generation/that he was cut off from the land of the living/_for the crime of my people,/_to whom the blow was due?

18721.text: ¶He was appointed among the wicked in death,/_among the rich was his burial;/yet he had done no violence,/_and deceit was not in his mouth.

18722.text: /But Jehovah willed to crush him,/_causing him suffering,/that, if he made his life an offering for guilt,/_he might see his offspring and prolong his days,/and that the purposes of Jehovah/_might prosper in his hand.

18723.text: ¶He shall see the toil of his soul and be satisfied;/_because of his knowledge,/and by bearing their iniquities,/_shall my servant, the righteous one, vindicate many.

18724.text: /I will assign him an inheritance among the great,/_and he shall divide the spoil with the mighty,/because he poured out his soul unto death,/_and was numbered with criminals—/he bore the sins of many,/_and made intercession for the transgressors.

18725.text: ¶Sing, O barren woman who did not give birth;/_break into jubilant song, you who were not in labor./The children of the deserted wife/_shall outnumber those of the espoused, says Jehovah.

18726.text: ¶Expand the site of your tent;/_extend the canopies of your dwellings./Do not hold back; lengthen your cords/_and strengthen your stakes.

18727.text: /For you shall spread abroad/_to the right and to the left;/your offspring shall dispossess the nations/_and resettle the desolate cities.

18728.text: ¶Be not fearful, for you shall not be confounded;/_be not ashamed, for you shall not be disgraced./You shall forget the shame of your youth/_and remember no more/_the reproach of your widowhood.

18729.text: /For he who espouses you is your Maker,/_whose name is Jehovah of Hosts;/he who redeems you is the Holy One of Israel,/_who is called the God of all the earth.

18730.text: ¶Jehovah calls you back/_as a spouse forsaken and forlorn,/a wife married in youth only to be rejected,/_says your God.

18731.text: /I forsook you indeed momentarily,/_but with loving compassion I will gather you up.

18732.text: /In fleeting exasperation I hid my face from you,/_but with everlasting charity/I will have compassion on you,/_says Jehovah, who redeems you.

18733.text: ¶This is to me as in the days of Noah,/_when I swore that the waters of Noah/_would no more flood the earth./So I swear to have no more anger toward you,/_never again to rebuke you.

18734.text: /For the mountains shall be removed/_and the hills collapse with shaking,/but my charity toward you shall never be removed,/_nor my covenant of peace be shaken,/says Jehovah, who has compassion on you.

18735.text: ¶Poor wretch, tempest‐tossed and disconsolate!/_I will lay antimony for your building stones/_and sapphires for your foundations;

18736.text: /I will make your skylights of jacinth,/_your gates of carbuncle,/_and your entire boundary of precious stones.

18737.text: /All your children shall be taught by Jehovah,/_and great shall be the peace of your posterity.

18738.text: /You shall be firmly established through righteousness;/_you will be far from oppression/_and have no cause to fear,/far from ruin, for it shall not approach you.

18739.text: ¶Those who gather into mobs are not of me;/_whoever masses against you shall fall because of you.

18740.text: /It is I who create the smith who fans the flaming coals,/_forging weapons to suit his purpose;/_it is I who create the ravager to destroy.

18741.text: /Whatever weapon is devised against you,/_it shall not succeed;/every tongue that rises to accuse you,/_you shall refute./This is the heritage of the servants of Jehovah,/_and such is their vindication by me, says Jehovah.

18742.text: ¶Attention, all who thirst; come for water!¶You who have no money,/_come and buy food, that you may eat./Come, buy wine and milk/_with no money and at no cost.

18743.text: /Why do you spend money on what is not bread,/_your labor on what does not satisfy?/Hear me well: Eat what is good,/_and your souls shall enjoy abundance.

18744.text: ¶Give ear and come unto me;/_pay heed, that your souls may live!/And I will make with you an everlasting covenant:/_my loving fidelity toward David.

18745.text: /See, I have appointed him as a witness to the nations,/_a prince and lawgiver of the peoples.

18746.text: /You will summon a nation that you did not know;/_a nation that did not know you will hasten to you—/because of Jehovah your God,/_the Holy One of Israel, who gloriously endows you.

18747.text: ¶Inquire of Jehovah while he is present;/_call upon him while he is near.

18748.text: /Let the wicked forsake their ways/_and sinful men their thoughts./Let them return to Jehovah,/_and he will have mercy on them;/to our God, who graciously pardons.

18749.text: ¶For my thoughts are not your thoughts,/_nor are your ways my ways, says Jehovah.

18750.text: /But as the heavens are higher than the earth,/_so are my ways higher than your ways/_and my thoughts higher than your thoughts.

18751.text: /And as the rains and snows descend from the sky,/_and return not to it without watering the earth,/to render it fertile and fruitful—/_providing seed for the sower and food for the eater—

18752.text: /so is the word that leaves my mouth:/_it does not return to me empty;/it accomplishes what I desire,/_achieves the purpose for which I sent it.

18753.text: ¶You shall depart in joy and be led back in peace;/_the mountains and hills shall sing at your presence/_and the trees of the meadows all clap their hands.

18754.text: /In place of the thornbush shall come up the cypress,/_in place of nettles, the myrtle./This shall serve as a testimony of Jehovah,/_an everlasting sign that shall not be done away.

18755.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_Observe justice and perform righteousness,/for my salvation will soon come/_when my righteousness is revealed.

18756.text: /Blessed is the man who does so—/_the person who holds fast to them—/who keeps the Sabbath without profaning it,/_who stays his hand from doing any evil.

18757.text: ¶Let not the foreigner who adheres to Jehovah say,/_Jehovah will surely exclude me from his people./And let not the eunuch say, I am but a barren tree.

18758.text: /For thus says Jehovah:/_As for the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths/and choose to do what I will—/_holding fast to my covenant—

18759.text: /to them I will give a handclasp and a name/_within the walls of my house/_that is better than sons and daughters;/I will endow them with an everlasting name/_that shall not be cut off.

18760.text: ¶And the foreigners who adhere to Jehovah/_to serve him,/who love the name of Jehovah,/_that they may be his servants—/all who keep the Sabbath without profaning it,/_holding fast to my covenant—

18761.text: /these I will bring to my holy mountain/_and gladden in my house of prayer./Their offerings and sacrifices/_shall be accepted on my altar,/for my house shall be known/_as a house of prayer for all nations.

18762.text: /Thus says my Lord Jehovah,/_who gathers up the outcasts of Israel:/I will gather others to those already gathered.

18763.text: ¶All you wild beasts, you animals of the forest,/_come and devour!

18764.text: /Their watchmen are altogether blind and unaware;/_all of them are but dumb watchdogs unable to bark,/lolling seers fond of slumber.

18765.text: ¶Gluttonous dogs, and insatiable,/_such indeed are insensible shepherds./They are all diverted to their own way,/_every one after his own advantage.

18766.text: /Come, they say, let us get wine/_and have our fill of liquor./For tomorrow will be like today, only far better!

18767.text: ¶The righteous disappear,/_and no man gives it a thought;/the godly are gathered out,/_but no one perceives that from impending calamity/_the righteous are withdrawn.

18768.text: /They who walk uprightly shall attain peace,/_and rest in their beds.

18769.text: ¶As for you, come here, you children of the sorceress,/_offspring of adulterer and harlot!

18770.text: /At whose expense do you amuse yourselves?/_At whom do you open wide the mouth/_and stick out the tongue?/Surely you are born of sin, a spurious brood,

18771.text: who burn with lust among the oaks,/_under every burgeoning tree,/slayers of children in the gullies/_under the crags of rocks.

18772.text: /Among the slippery stones of the ravines/_shall be your fate; they indeed are your lot./To them you pour out libations and make offerings./_How shall I be appeased of such things?

18773.text: ¶On a lofty mountain/_you have made prominent your bed,/_and there you ascend to offer sacrifices.

18774.text: /Behind doors and facades/_you have put up your emblems,/and have exposed yourself to others than I:/_mounting your bed, you have laid it wide open./And you bargain with those with whom you love to lie,/_your hand on their nakedness.

18775.text: ¶You bathe with oils for the king/_and increase your perfumes;/you send your solicitors far abroad/_and debase yourself to the depths.

18776.text: /Though wearied by your excessive ways,/_you have not admitted despair;/you have found livelihood,/_and therefore have not slackened.

18777.text: ¶Yet on whose account are you uneasy and apprehensive,/_that you pretend and do not mention me,/_nor even give me a thought?/Is it because I have so long kept silent/_that you no longer fear me?

18778.text: /But I will expose your fornication/_and the wantonness of your exploits.

18779.text: /When you cry out in distress,/_let those who flock to you save you!/A wind shall carry all of them off;/_a vapor shall take them away.¶But they who seek refuge in me shall possess the earth/_and receive an inheritance in my holy mountain.

18780.text: ¶It will be said: Excavate, pave a road!/_Prepare the way;/_remove the obstacles from the path of my people!

18781.text: ¶Thus says he who is highly exalted,/_who abides forever, whose name is sacred:/I dwell on high in the holy place,/_and with him who is humble and lowly in spirit—/refreshing the spirits of the lowly,/_reviving the hearts of the humble.

18782.text: /I will not contend forever, nor always be angry;/_the spirits and souls I have made would faint before me.

18783.text: ¶By his sin of covetousness I was provoked;/_I struck him and hid my face in anger/_when he strayed by following the ways of his heart.

18784.text: /Yet I have seen his conduct and I will heal him;/_I will guide him and amply console him/_and those who mourn for him,

18785.text: /who partake of the fruit of the lips:/_Peace, wellbeing, to those far off/and to those who are near,/_says Jehovah who heals him.

18786.text: ¶But the wicked are like the raging Sea,/_unable to rest,/_whose waters heave up mire and mud:

18787.text: /there is no peace, says my God, for the wicked.

18788.text: ¶Proclaim it aloud without restraint;/_raise your voice like a trumpet!/Declare to my people their transgressions,/_to the house of Jacob its sins.

18789.text: /Yet they importune me daily,/_eager to learn my ways,/like a nation practicing righteousness/_and not forsaking the precepts of its God.¶They inquire of me concerning correct ordinances,/_desiring to draw nearer to God:

18790.text: ¶Why, when we fast, do you not notice?/_We afflict our bodies and you remain indifferent!/It is because on your fast day you pursue your own ends/_and constrain all who toil for you.

18791.text: /You fast amid strife and contention,/_striking out savagely with the fist./Your present fasts are not such/_as to make your voice heard on high.

18792.text: ¶Is this the manner of fasting I have required,/_just a time for men to torment themselves?/Is it only for bowing one’s head like a reed/_and making one’s bed of sackcloth and ashes?/Do you call that a fast,/_a day of Jehovah’s good graces?

18793.text: ¶Is not this the fast I require:/_To release from wrongful bondage,/_to untie the harness of the yoke,/to set the oppressed at liberty/_and abolish all forms of subjection?

18794.text: /Is it not to share your food with the hungry,/_to bring home the wretchedly poor,/and when you see men underclad to clothe them,/_and not to neglect your own kin?

18795.text: ¶Then shall your light break through like the dawn/_and your healing speedily appear;/your righteousness will go before you,/_and the glory of Jehovah will be your rearguard.

18796.text: ¶Then, should you call, Jehovah will respond;/_should you cry, he will say, I am here./Indeed, if you will banish servitude from among you,/_and the pointing finger and offensive speech,

18797.text: /if you will give of your own to the hungry/_and satisfy the needs of the oppressed,/then shall your light dawn amid darkness/_and your twilight become as the noonday.

18798.text: ¶Jehovah will direct you continually;/_he will satisfy your needs in the dearth/_and bring vigor to your limbs./And you will become like a well‐watered garden,/_like a spring of unfailing waters.

18799.text: /They who came out of you will rebuild the ancient ruins;/_you will restore the foundations of generations ago./You shall be called a rebuilder of fallen walls,/_a restorer of streets for resettlement.

18800.text: ¶If you will keep your feet from trampling the Sabbath—/_from achieving your own ends on my holy day—/and consider the Sabbath a delight,/_the holy day of Jehovah venerable,/and if you will honor it/_by refraining from your everyday pursuits—/from occupying yourselves with your own affairs/_and speaking of business matters—

18801.text: /then shall you delight in Jehovah,/_and I will make you traverse the heights of the earth/and nourish you with the heritage of Jacob your father./_By his mouth Jehovah has spoken it.

18802.text: ¶Surely Jehovah’s hand has not become too short to save,/_nor his ear dull of hearing!

18803.text: /It is your iniquities that separate you from your God;/_your sins hide his face, so that he does not hear you.

18804.text: /For your palms are defiled with blood,/_your fingers with iniquity;/your lips speak guile, your tongue utters duplicity.

18805.text: /None calls for righteousness;/_no one sues for an honest cause./They rely on empty words, deceitfully spoken;/_they conceive misdeeds, they beget wickedness.

18806.text: ¶They hatch vipers’ eggs and spin spiders’ webs;/_whoever eats of their eggs dies,/_and if any is smashed, there emerges a serpent.

18807.text: /Their cobwebs are useless as clothing;/_their fabrications are worthless for covering themselves./Their works consist of wrongdoing;/_they manipulate injurious dealings.

18808.text: ¶Their feet rush after evil;/_they hasten to shed innocent blood./Their thoughts are preoccupied with mischief;/_havoc and disaster follow in their wake.

18809.text: /They are unacquainted with the way of perfection;/_integrity is not within their bounds./They have made crooked their paths;/_none who treads them knows peace.

18810.text: ¶Therefore redress remains far from us/_and righteousness is unable to reach us./We look for light, but there prevails darkness;/_for a glimmer of hope, but we walk amid gloom.

18811.text: /We grope along the borders like the blind;/_we flounder like those without eyes./We stumble at noon as in the dark of night;/_in the prime of life we resemble the dead.

18812.text: /We grumble like bears, all of us;/_we moan incessantly like doves./We expect justice when there is none;/_we look for salvation, but it eludes us.

18813.text: ¶For our transgressions before you have multiplied;/_our sins testify against us./Our offenses are evident; we perceive our iniquities:

18814.text: /willfully denying Jehovah,/_backing away from following our God,/perversely planning ways of extortion,/_conceiving in the mind and pondering/_illicit transactions.

18815.text: /And so redress is compelled to back away,/_and righteousness to stand at a distance;/truth stumbles in the public place/_and uprightness cannot enter.

18816.text: ¶When integrity is lacking,/_they who shun evil become a prey./Jehovah saw that there was no justice,/_and it displeased him.

18817.text: /When he saw it, he wondered/_ why there was no man, no one who would intercede.¶So his own arm brought about salvation for him;/_ his righteousness rallied to his cause.

18818.text: /He put on righteousness as a breastplate/_and made salvation the helmet on his head;/he clothed himself with vengeance for a garment/_and wrapped himself in fury as in a robe.

18819.text: /According to what they deserve, he will repay them:/_wrath upon his adversaries,/_reprisals upon his enemies;/to the isles he will render retribution.

18820.text: ¶From the west men will fear Jehovah Omnipotent,/_and from the rising of the sun his glory./For he will come upon them like a hostile torrent/_impelled by the Spirit of Jehovah.

18821.text: /But he will come as Redeemer to Zion,/_to those of Jacob who repent of transgression,/_says Jehovah.

18822.text: ¶As for me, this is my covenant with them, says Jehovah: My Spirit which is upon you and my words which I have placed in your mouth shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your offspring, nor from the mouth of their offspring, says Jehovah, from now on and forever.

18823.text: ¶Arise, shine, your light has dawned;/_the glory of Jehovah has risen upon you!

18824.text: /Although darkness covers the earth,/_and a thick mist the peoples,/upon you Jehovah will shine;/_over you his glory shall be visible.

18825.text: /Nations will come to your light,/_their kings to the brightness of your dawn.

18826.text: /Lift up your eyes and look about you!/_They have all assembled to come to you:/your sons shall arrive from afar;/_your daughters shall return to your side.

18827.text: ¶Then, when you see it, your face will light up,/_your heart swell with awe:/the multitude of the Sea shall resort to you;/_a host of nations shall enter you.

18828.text: /A myriad of camels shall cover your land,/_the dromedaries of Midian and Ephah;/all from Sheba will come,/_bearing gold and frankincense/_and heralding the praises of Jehovah.

18829.text: /All Kedar’s flocks will gather to you,/_the rams of Nebaioth will serve you;/they shall be accepted as offerings on my altar,/_and thus I will make glorious my house of glory.

18830.text: ¶Who are these, aloft like clouds,/_flying as doves to their portals?

18831.text: /From the isles they are gathering to me,/_the ships of Tarshish in the lead,/to bring back your children from afar,/_and with them their silver and gold,/to Jehovah Omnipotent, your God,/_to the Holy One of Israel,/who has made you illustrious.

18832.text: ¶Foreigners will rebuild your walls,/_and their kings will minister to you./Though I struck you in anger,/_I will gladly show you mercy.

18833.text: /Your gates shall always remain open;/_they shall not be shut day or night,/that a host of nations may be brought to you/_and their kings escorted in.

18834.text: /And the nation or kingdom/_that will not serve you shall perish;/such nations shall be utterly ruined.

18835.text: ¶The splendor of Lebanon shall become yours—/_cypresses, pines, and firs together—/to beautify the site of my sanctuary,/_to make glorious the place of my feet.

18836.text: /The sons of those who tormented you/_will come bowing before you;/all who reviled you will prostrate themselves at your feet./_They will call you the City of Jehovah,/Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

18837.text: ¶Although you had been forsaken and abhorred,/_with none passing through your land,/yet I will make you an everlasting pride,/_the joy of generation after generation.

18838.text: /You will suck the milk of the nations,/_suckling at the breasts of kings./Then shall you know that I, Jehovah,/_am your Savior,/that your Redeemer is the Valiant One of Jacob.

18839.text: ¶In place of copper I will bring gold,/_in place of iron, silver;/in place of wood I will bring copper,/_in place of stones, iron./I will make peace your rulers/_and righteousness your oppressors:

18840.text: /tyranny shall no more be heard of in your land,/_nor dispossession or disaster within your borders;/you will regard salvation as your walls/_and homage as your gates.

18841.text: ¶No longer shall the sun be your light by day,/_nor the brightness of the moon/_your illumination at night:/Jehovah will be your everlasting light/_and your God your radiant glory.

18842.text: /Your sun shall set no more,/_nor your moon wane:/to you Jehovah shall be an endless light/_when your days of mourning are fulfilled.

18843.text: ¶Your entire people shall be righteous;/_they shall inherit the earth forever—/they are the branch I have planted,/_the work of my hands, in which I am glorified.

18844.text: /The least of them shall become a clan,/_the youngest a mighty nation./I Jehovah will hasten it in its time.

18845.text: ¶The Spirit of my Lord Jehovah is upon me,/_for Jehovah has anointed me/to announce good tidings to the lowly;/_he has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted,/to proclaim liberty to the captives/_and the opening of the eyes to the bound,

18846.text: /to herald the year of Jehovah’s favor/_and the day of vengeance of our God,/to comfort all who mourn:

18847.text: /to endow those who mourn in Zion,/_bestowing upon them a priestly headpiece/_in place of ashes,/the festal anointing in place of mourning,/_a resplendent robe in place of a downcast spirit./They shall be called oaks of righteousness/_planted by Jehovah for his glory.

18848.text: ¶They will rebuild the ancient ruins,/_raise up the old waste places;/they will renew the desolate cities/_demolished generations ago.

18849.text: /Aliens will tend and pasture your flocks;/_foreigners will be your farmhands and vinedressers.

18850.text: ¶But you shall be called the priests of Jehovah/_and referred to as the ministers of our God./You shall feed on the wealth of the nations/_and be gratified with their choicest provision.

18851.text: /Because their shame was twofold,/_and shouted insults were their lot,/therefore in their land/_shall their inheritance be twofold/and everlasting joy be theirs.

18852.text: ¶For I Jehovah love just dealings—/_but I abhor extortion in those who sacrifice—/and I will appoint them a sure reward;/_I will make with them an eternal covenant.

18853.text: /Their offspring shall be renowned among the nations,/_their posterity in the midst of the peoples;/all who see them will acknowledge/_that they are of the lineage Jehovah has blessed.

18854.text: ¶I rejoice exceedingly in Jehovah;/_my soul delights in my God./For he clothes me in garments of salvation,/_he arrays me in a robe of righteousness—/like a bridegroom dressed in priestly attire,/_or a bride adorned with her jewels.

18855.text: /For as the earth brings forth its vegetation,/_and as a garden causes what is sown to spring up in it,/so will my Lord Jehovah/_cause righteousness and praise to spring up/in the presence of all nations.

18856.text: ¶For Zion’s sake I will not keep silent;/_for Jerusalem’s sake I will not remain still/till her righteousness shines like a light,/_her salvation like a flaming torch.

18857.text: /The nations shall behold your righteousness/_and all their rulers your glory;/you shall be called by a new name/_conferred by the mouth of Jehovah.

18858.text: ¶Then shall you be a crown of glory/_in the hand of Jehovah,/_a royal diadem in the palm of your God.

18859.text: /You shall no more be called the forsaken one,/_nor your land referred to as desolate;/you shall be known as her in whom I delight/_and your land considered espoused./For Jehovah shall delight in you,/_and your land shall be espoused.

18860.text: /As a young man weds a virgin,/_so shall your sons wed you;/as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride,/_so shall your God rejoice over you.

18861.text: ¶I have appointed watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem,/_who shall not be silent day or night./You who call upon Jehovah, let not up

18862.text: nor give him respite till he reestablishes Jerusalem/_and makes it renowned in the earth.

18863.text: ¶Jehovah has sworn by his right hand, his mighty arm:/_I will no more let your grain be food for your enemies,/nor shall foreigners drink the new wine you have toiled for.

18864.text: /Those who harvest it shall eat it,/_giving praise to Jehovah;/those who gather it shall drink it/_within the environs of my sanctuary.

18865.text: ¶Pass on, go through gates;/_prepare the way for the people!/Excavate, pave a highway cleared of stones;/_raise the ensign to the nations!

18866.text: /Jehovah has made proclamation to the end of the earth:/_Tell the Daughter of Zion,/See, your Salvation comes,/_his reward with him, his work preceding him.

18867.text: /They shall be called the holy people,/_the redeemed of Jehovah;/and you shall be known as in demand,/_a city never deserted.

18868.text: ¶Who is this coming from Edom in red‐stained garments?/_Who is this from Bozrah, arrayed in majesty,/_pressing forward in the strength of his power?/It is I, who am mighty to save,/_announcing righteousness!

18869.text: ¶Why are you clothed in red, your garments/_like those who tread grapes in the winepress?

18870.text: /Alone I have trodden out a vatful;/_of the nations no one was with me./I trod them down in my anger;/_in my wrath I trampled them./Their lifeblood spattered my garments,/_and I have stained my whole attire.

18871.text: ¶For I had resolved on a day of vengeance,/_and the year of my redeemed had come.

18872.text: ¶I glanced around, but none would lend help;/_I glared, but no one would assist./So my own arm brought about salvation for me,/_and my wrath, it assisted me.

18873.text: /I trod nations underfoot in my anger;/_I made them drunk by my rage/when I cast their glory to the ground.

18874.text: ¶I will recount in praise of Jehovah/_Jehovah’s loving favors,/according to all that Jehovah has done for us,/_according to the great kindness/he has mercifully and most graciously/_rendered the house of Israel.

18875.text: ¶For he thought, Surely they are my people,/_sons who will not play false;/and so he became their Savior:

18876.text: /with all their troubles he troubled himself,/_the angel of his presence delivering them./In his love and compassion/_he himself redeemed them;/he lifted them up and carried them/_all the days of old.

18877.text: /Yet they rebelled and grieved his holy Spirit,/_till he became their enemy/and himself fought against them.

18878.text: ¶Then his people recalled the days of Moses of old:/_Where is he who brought them up out of the Sea/with the shepherd of his flock?/_Where is he who put into him his holy Spirit,

18879.text: /who made his glorious arm proceed/_at the right hand of Moses,/who divided the waters before them,/_making an everlasting name for himself

18880.text: /when he led them through the deep?¶Like the horse of the desert, they stumbled not;

18881.text: /like cattle descending the slopes of ravines,/_it was the Spirit of Jehovah that guided them./So you led your people, O Jehovah,/_acquiring illustrious renown.

18882.text: ¶O look down from heaven,/_from your holy and glorious celestial abode,/and behold!/_Where now are your zeal and your might?/The yearnings of your bosom and your compassion/_are withheld from us!

18883.text: /Surely you are our Father!/_Though Abraham does not know us/_or Israel recognize us,/you, O Jehovah, are our Father;/_Our Redeemer from Eternity is your name.

18884.text: ¶Why, O Jehovah, have you made us stray from your ways,/_hardening our hearts so that we do not fear you?/Relent, for the sake of your servants,/_the tribes that are your inheritance.

18885.text: /But a little while had your people possessed the holy place/_when our enemies trod down your sanctuary.

18886.text: /We have become as those/_whom you have never ruled/and who have not been known by your name

18887.text: ¶O that you would rend the heavens and descend,/_the mountains melting at your presence—

18888.text: /as when fire is lit for boiling water,/_which bubbles over from the heat—/to make yourself known to your adversaries,/_the nations trembling at your presence—

18889.text: /as when you performed awesome things/_unexpected by us: your descent of old,/_when the mountains quaked before you!

18890.text: /Never has it been heard or perceived by the ear,/_nor has any eye seen a God besides you,/who acts thus on behalf of those who wait for him.

18891.text: ¶But you wound those of us/_who joyfully perform righteousness,/who remember you by following your ways—/_that in them we might ever be saved./Alas, you were roused to anger when we sinned,

18892.text: /and now we have altogether become as those defiled,/_the sum of our righteousness as a menstruous rag./We are decaying like leaves, all of us;/_our sins, like a wind, sweep us away.

18893.text: ¶Yet none calls upon your name,/_or rouses himself to take hold of you./For you have hidden your face from us/_and enfeebled us at the hand of our iniquities.

18894.text: /Nevertheless, you are our Father, O Jehovah;/_we are the clay and you are the potter,/_and we are all alike the work of your hands.

18895.text: /Be not exceedingly angry, O Jehovah;/_remember not iniquity forever./See, consider that we are all your people!

18896.text: ¶Your holy cities have become a wilderness;/_Zion is a desert, Jerusalem a desolation.

18897.text: /Our glorious holy temple/_where our fathers praised you/has been burned with fire,/_and all places dear to us lie in ruins.

18898.text: /At all this, O Jehovah, will you restrain yourself,/_in silence letting us suffer so exceedingly?

18899.text: ¶I was available to those who did not inquire of me;/_I was accessible to those who did not seek me./I said, Here am I; I am here,/_to a nation that did not invoke my name.

18900.text: ¶I held out my hands all the day to a defiant people,/_who walk in ways that are not good,/_following their own imagination—

18901.text: /a people who constantly provoke me to my face,/_sacrificing in parks, making smoke upon bricks,

18902.text: /who sit in sepulchres, spend nights in hideouts,/_who eat swine’s flesh,/_their bowls full of polluted broth,

18903.text: /who think, Keep your distance,/_don’t come near me; I am holier than you!/Such are a smoke to my nostrils,/_a fire smoldering all day long.

18904.text: ¶See, it is written before me that I will not be still/_till I have paid back into their bosom

18905.text: /their own iniquities and their fathers’ alike,/_says Jehovah./To those who kindle sacrifice in the mountains,/_who affront me on the hills, I will measure out/_in their laps the payment that has accrued.

18906.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_As when there is juice in a cluster of grapes/and someone says, Don’t destroy it, it is still good,/_so I will do for the sake of my servants/_by not destroying everything:

18907.text: /I will extract offspring out of Jacob,/_and out of Judah heirs of my mountains;/my chosen ones shall inherit them,/_my servants shall dwell there.

18908.text: /Sharon shall become pasture for flocks,/_and the Valley of Achor a resting place/for the herds of my people who seek me.

18909.text: ¶As for you who forsake Jehovah/_and forget my holy mountain,/who spread tables for Luck/_and pour mixed wines for Fortune,

18910.text: /I will destine you to the sword;/_all of you shall succumb to the slaughter./For when I called, you did not respond;/_when I spoke, you would not give heed./You did what was evil in my eyes;/_you chose to do what was not my will.

18911.text: ¶Therefore thus says my Lord Jehovah:¶My servants shall eat indeed,/_while you shall hunger;/my servants shall drink indeed,/_while you shall thirst;/my servants shall rejoice indeed,/_while you shall be dismayed.

18912.text: /My servants shall shout indeed, for gladness of heart,/_while you shall cry out with heartbreak,/_howling from brokenness of spirit.

18913.text: /Your name shall be left/_to serve my chosen ones as a curse/_when my Lord Jehovah slays you./But his servants he will call by a different name.

18914.text: ¶Those of them who invoke blessings/_on themselves in the earth shall do so by the true God,/and those of them who swear oaths in the earth/_shall do so by the God of truth./The troubles of the past shall be forgotten/_and hidden from my eyes.

18915.text: ¶See, I create new heavens and a new earth;/_former events shall not be remembered/_or recalled to mind.

18916.text: /Rejoice, then, and be glad forever in what I create./_See, I create Jerusalem to be a delight/_and its people a joy.

18917.text: ¶I will delight in Jerusalem, rejoice in my people;/_no more shall be heard there/_the sound of weeping or the cry of distress.

18918.text: /No more shall there be infants alive but a few days,/_or the aged who do not live out their years;/those who die young shall be a hundred years old,/_and those who fail to reach a hundred shall be accursed.

18919.text: ¶When men build houses, they will dwell in them;/_when they plant vineyards, they will eat their fruit.

18920.text: /They shall not build so that others may dwell,/_or plant so that others may eat./The lifetime of my people shall be as the lifetime of a tree;/_my chosen ones shall outlast the work of their hands.

18921.text: ¶They shall not exert themselves in vain,/_or bear children doomed for calamity./For they are of the lineage of those Jehovah has blessed,/_and their posterity with them.

18922.text: /Before they call I will reply;/_while they are yet speaking I will respond.

18923.text: ¶The wolf and the lamb will graze alike,/_and the lion will eat straw like the ox;/as for the serpent, dust shall be its food:/_there shall be no harm or injury done/throughout my holy mountain, says Jehovah.

18924.text: ¶Thus says Jehovah:/_The heavens are my throne/_and the earth is my footstool./What house would you build me?/_What would serve me as a place of rest?

18925.text: /These are all things my hand has made,/_and thus all came into being, says Jehovah./And yet I have regard for those/_who are of a humble and contrite spirit/and who are vigilant for my word.

18926.text: ¶But whoever slaughters an ox/_is as one who kills a man,/and whoever sacrifices a lamb,/_as one who breaks a dog’s neck;/whoever presents a grain offering/_is as one who offers swine’s blood,/and whoever burns incense,/_as one who venerates idols./Just as they have preferred to go their own ways,/_their souls delighting in their abominations,

18927.text: /so will I prescribe intrigues for them/_and bring upon them the thing they dread./For when I called, no one responded;/_when I spoke, none gave heed./They did what was evil in my eyes;/_they chose to do what was not my will.

18928.text: ¶Hear the word of Jehovah,/_you who are vigilant for his word:/Your brethren who abhor you,/_and exclude you because of my name, say,/Let Jehovah manifest his glory,/_that we may see cause for your joy!/But it is they who shall suffer shame.

18929.text: ¶Hark, a tumult from the city, a noise from the temple!/_It is the voice of Jehovah/paying his enemies what is due them.

18930.text: ¶Before she is in labor, she gives birth;/_before her ordeal overtakes her, she delivers a son!

18931.text: /Who has heard the like,/_or who has seen such things?/Can the earth labor but a day/_and a nation be born at once?/For as soon as she was in labor,/_Zion gave birth to her children.

18932.text: /Shall I bring to a crisis and not bring on birth?/_says Jehovah./When it is I who cause the birth,/_shall I hinder it? says your God.

18933.text: ¶Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her,/_all who love her;/join in her celebration, all who mourn for her.

18934.text: /From now on nurse contentedly/_at her consoling breasts;/draw at your pleasure/_from the abundance of her bosom.

18935.text: ¶For thus says Jehovah: See,/_I will extend peace to her like a river,/_the bounty of the nations like a stream in flood./Then shall you nurse and be carried upon the hip/_and dandled on the knees.

18936.text: /As one who is comforted by his mother/_I will comfort you;/for Jerusalem you shall be comforted.

18937.text: ¶Your heart shall rejoice to see it,/_your limbs flourish like sprouting grass,/when the hand of Jehovah/_shall be manifest among his servants/_and his rage among his enemies.

18938.text: /See, Jehovah comes with fire,/_his chariots like a whirlwind,/to retaliate in furious anger,/_to rebuke with conflagrations of fire.

18939.text: /For with fire and with his sword shall Jehovah/_execute judgment on all flesh,/and those slain by Jehovah shall be many.

18940.text: ¶As for the cultists who fornicate in the parks, the devotees of one in the center, who eat the flesh of swine and prawn and rodents—they with [their practices and ideas] shall be made an end of, says Jehovah.

18941.text: ¶For I will come to gather all nations and tongues, that they may approach and behold my glory.

18942.text: ¶And I will set a mark upon them, sending those of them who survive to the nations that had not heard the news concerning me, nor seen my glory—to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud (the archers), to Tubal and Javan, and to the distant isles. And they shall declare my glory among the nations

18943.text: and shall bring back all your brethren from throughout the nations to Jerusalem my holy mountain, says Jehovah, as offerings to Jehovah—on horses, in chariots and wagons, and on mules and dromedaries—just as the Israelites brought offerings in pure vessels to the house of Jehovah.

18944.text: Of them likewise I will accept men to be priests and Levites, says Jehovah.

18945.text: ¶And as the new heavens and the new earth which I make shall endure before me, says Jehovah, so shall your offspring and name endure.

18946.text: And New Moon after New Moon, Sabbath after Sabbath, all flesh shall come to worship before me, says Jehovah.

18947.text: And they shall go out and look upon the corpses of the people who transgressed against me, whose worms do not die and whose fire shall not be extinguished. They shall be a horror to all flesh.
